### Battle Royale

In the Battle Royale mode, players compete against each other in an intense survival game. The objective is to be the last person standing by eliminating opponents while avoiding being eliminated oneself. As the match progresses, the play area shrinks, which forces players into closer encounters and adds to the excitement. Players can find weapons and resources scattered throughout the map, which are crucial for their survival. Strategic gameplay, quick reflexes, and teamwork can significantly increase one's chances of winning in this highly competitive environment.

Battle Royale is the first mode you unlock when you play the game for the first time. In this mode, there are five teams, each consisting of three players, for a total of 15 players. You will be assigned to a random team with two other players, and together, you will fight against the other teams. The map features a safe zone that shrinks over time; anyone outside this safe zone will take damage, and the longer you remain outside, the more damage you will incur. Throughout the game, you can collect ammunition, armor, upgrades, ability charges, and crates to enhance your gameplay.

The longer you stay outside the safe zone, the more challenges you will face. In this area, you will find ammunition, armor, upgrades, ability charges, and crates that players can collect to strengthen their character. If you get eliminated, you will be knocked down and unable to do anything except look around. Your teammate can revive you so you can continue playing, but if they are too late, you will die and enter spectator mode. If two players on your team are knocked down and the last remaining player is eliminated, your team will automatically lose and enter spectator mode.

If a player in your team is knocked out and the last remaining member gets killed, your team will automatically lose and enter spectator mode. You will be ranked based on how long your team survived, with rank number 1 being awarded to the last team standing and rank number 5 going to the first team that was eliminated.

Check out the maps for each game mode by clicking this link.

### King Of The Hill 

Make sure to review the King of the Hill game mode for more insights and strategies.

King of the Hill is unlocked once you enter the second league. In this mode, players engage in a free-for-all competition on a map, where each person fights solo against others and aims to become the last player standing. You will compete against 11 other players. Throughout the match, you can find ammunition, armor, upgrades, ability charges, and crates to enhance your strength. In this mode, you will be instantly eliminated if you are defeated, rather than being downed.

In this mode, players can collect charges and crates to become stronger. Instead of being downed, you will instantly die, as there are no allies to revive you. The map features a safe zone that shrinks over time; anyone caught outside the safe zone will take damage, which will increase the longer they remain outside. Players will be ranked based on their survival time, with the ranking from number 1 for the last person standing to number 12 for the first one who died.

### Squad VS Squad

In the Squad VS Squad game mode, players form teams and compete against each other. The objective is to work collaboratively to outmaneuver and eliminate opposing squads. Effective communication and strategy are crucial for achieving victory. Team dynamics play an essential role, as players must coordinate their actions and make strategic decisions based on the evolving situation on the battlefield. Understanding each squad member's strengths and weaknesses can significantly enhance performance, making teamwork the key to success in this competitive environment.

Squad VS Squad is unlocked once you enter the second league. This mode can only be played during specific times; it is available for 30 minutes and then closes, becoming accessible again after approximately 5 hours. There will be two teams, each consisting of five players (a total of 10 players in the game). The objective is to defeat or eliminate all players on the opposing team. You will spawn with armor and your hero's main weapon, which has infinite ammo. Upgrades, armor, and crates will still spawn on the map. Additionally, your downed timer will run twice as fast.

In this game, the hero's main weapon has infinite ammo, and upgrades, armor, and crates continue to spawn on the map. The downed timer is twice as fast compared to other modes. The winning team is the one that can outlast the other team, so teamwork is essential.

### Sabotage

Sabotage mode introduces a unique gameplay element where players must strategically disrupt their opponents' plans to achieve victory. In this mode, teamwork and cunning tactics are essential for success, as players navigate through challenges while attempting to thwart the efforts of their rivals. This exciting variant requires a combination of skill, strategy, and collaboration.

Underground Base Map with Item Locations

[![Underground base map](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/bullet-echo/images/f/f4/Underground_base_map.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20201218212625)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/bullet-echo/images/f/f4/Underground_base_map.png/revision/latest?cb=20201218212625)

**Underground Base Map with Item Locations**

The objective of the game mode is to either defend the bomb as the attacker or to defuse the bomb as the defender. Roles switch, but a match can play up to three rounds. There are no knockout (KO) mechanics, so once you’re out, you’re out. The first team to achieve two victories wins the match. 

A key rule is that you can only play each character once per round. Therefore, it’s advisable to choose three characters you really enjoy before starting the game.

### Arcade

Don't fabricate facts or create false information. Your task is to enhance the coherence of the text and make it easier to understand. If the text includes URLs or hyperlinks, remove them while keeping the text intact.

Arcade is a limited-time game mode where players can hold a maximum of 10 tickets, although there is no limit on VIP Tickets. At the start of each Arcade session, players begin with 3 out of 10 tickets. Each battle consumes one ticket. Points are earned for each battle completed, and the reward track includes a Skin at the end. Players can earn between 0 and 800 points in each reward pool. Other available rewards include Style Tickets, Stickers, Sprays, and more.

The Custom gamemode allows players to create their own battles.

**P.Y.R.O.** - Armed People's Groups are not highly coordinated, yet they are numerous enough to be overlooked. They do not align with any existing factions, as they reject the concepts of technocracy and dictatorship from the old order. These groups consist of free street fighters, saboteurs, and stalkers who are equipped with captured weapons. Occasionally, they receive financial support from unknown sources.

# Factions/Renegades

Factions are a key aspect of the game, and the Renegades stand out as a unique group within this framework.

- History
- Purge
- Talk (0)
Renegades

**Renegades** are an influential anarchist organization of soldiers of fortune that undertakes both open and covert contract assignments. They thrive on maintaining the status quo, benefiting from ongoing conflicts and the redistribution of zones of influence. This organization also serves as a refuge for renegades from other factions, welcoming those who have shown unwavering loyalty to their new home.

The Infantry Vest is a body-type gear that was introduced in update 3.3. It is not part of any set and can be used by all heroes.

This gear is not part of a set and can be used by all heroes. 

It resembles a vest with two pockets and features a red heart shape sewn onto it. 

## Effects 

The Infantry Vest increases a hero's health by a percentage, providing an additional +x% to maximum health. The effects vary depending on its tier.

Increases a Hero's maximum health by +x%.

The effect varies based on the item's tier. For example, if the item is epic, it will provide an epic effect.

| Modifier Table |
| --- |
| **Common Effect:** +3% increase to hero's maximum health |
| **Rare Effect:** +5% increase to hero's maximum health |
| **Epic Effect:** +6% increase to hero's maximum health |
| **Legendary Effect:** +7% increase to hero's maximum health |
| **Mythic Effect:** +8% increase to hero's maximum health |
| **Supreme Effect:** +9% increase to hero's maximum health |
| **Ultimate Effect:** +10% increase to hero's maximum health |
| **Celestial Effect:** +11% increase to hero's maximum health |

Thanks to breakthroughs in cybernetics, computers, and bioengineering technologies, factions rather than governments have gained significant influence, allowing them to compete for dominance in the world. This shift has opened up new possibilities for people, including high-tech implants, genome modifications, energy shields, and enhanced abilities such as x-ray vision, ultra-short spatial jumps, and short-term invisibility.

You are the "pilots" of Echo, which consists of high-tech clones of the best fighters from each faction. You share in the glory of victory with these organizations, and in return, they provide you with their most advanced killing machines. It’s a fair deal, right?

This Gear is not part of a set and can be used by all heroes.

## Gear Description

### Effects

Increases the hero's movement speed by +X% without incurring an aiming penalty.

The Silver Surfer is a fictional superhero appearing in comic books published by Marvel Comics. He first appeared in "Fantastic Four" #48 in 1966. Originally known as Norrin Radd from the planet Zenn-La, he becomes the Silver Surfer after making a pact with Galactus to protect his home from destruction. Gifted with cosmic powers, he can manipulate energy and travel faster than the speed of light. The character is often portrayed as a complex figure, grappling with themes of existentialism and morality while exploring his identity in the universe. Throughout his adventures, the Silver Surfer has interacted with various heroes, including the Fantastic Four and Thanos, and has played significant roles in multiple storylines across the Marvel Universe.

# Regular Body Armour

Regular Body Armour is a protective gear designed to enhance the defense of the user. It is crucial for maintaining safety during engagements in various scenarios. This type of armour offers a balance between mobility and protection, making it an essential choice for many players. The following sections will explore its features, advantages, and optimal usage in different contexts.

The Regular Body Armour is a type of gear introduced in update 3.3. It is not part of a set and can be used by all heroes. Its design resembles a bulletproof vest.

This gear is not part of a set and can be used by all heroes. 

It resembles a bulletproof vest.

## Effects

Regular Body Armour increases a hero's armor by a percentage, offering '+x% to the hero's maximum armor.' 

The effect varies based on its tier; for example, if it is an epic tier, it will provide an epic effect.

# Classes
The class of a Hero is defined by their medical abilities and the weapons they wield. Currently, there are five distinct classes in the game.

## Contents

1. Snipers  
2. Tanks  
3. Troopers  
4. Scouts  
5. Ambushers

## Snipers

Snipers play a crucial role in tactical operations. They are skilled marksmen who excel at long-range shooting, using precision and stealth to take down targets from a distance. Their training involves not only marksmanship but also camouflage techniques and reconnaissance skills, allowing them to gather intelligence while remaining undetected. Effective communication with their team is essential, as snipers often provide critical support and information that can influence the outcome of missions. Overall, snipers are valuable assets in any strategic engagement.

The sniper class has access to Bandages as a medical ability, which provides quick HP recovery and reduces movement noise. They also utilize the Dark Predator gear set, which includes the characters Firefly, Blot, Mirage, Slayer, and Lynx. Snipers excel in long-range combat, using their high accuracy and damage to eliminate targets from a distance. However, they struggle with rapid shooting in close quarters, except for Firefly, who benefits from his Sting passive ability.

## Tanks

Don't make up facts or hallucinate. Your job is to make the text more coherent and easier to understand, only.

Their medical ability is the Battle kit. This class serves as a tank for other team members and boasts significant health and armor, with both parameters exceeding a thousand. They utilize light machine guns (LMGs) and have access to the Heavy Borg gear set. The tank class includes the following characters: Bastion, Smog, Bertha, Leviathan, and Dragoon.

## Troopers

Troopers are the Assault Rifle heroes, equipped with Team Healing as their medical ability. They represent a balanced approach, situated between Scouts and Tanks. This class includes Stalker, Levi, Satoshi, Doc, and Tess.

## Scouts

Don't create fictional facts or hallucinations. Your task is to enhance the coherence and clarity of the text, ensuring it is easier to understand.

Their medical ability is called Stim, which heals them over a few seconds and increases their movement speed. They are small and can fit through small holes in walls. These characters are referred to as SMG Heroes, or Sub-Machine Gunners. The characters include Raven, Freddy, Ghost, and Angel.

## Ambushers

Ambushers, also known as Shotgunners, have access to the White Marble set. The Ambusher class includes the following characters: Sparkle, Arnie, Hurricane, Cyclops, and Shengi. They excel in close-range combat, where most of their shotgun pellets can effectively hit the target.

## Lore

### Main

Sparkle's lore was posted by JK Eff on Discord on October 12, 2021, and written by Fahad "foxmindedguy" Kazi. 

Please avoid fabricating facts or creating inaccuracies. Your role is solely to enhance the coherence and clarity of the text.

She sat quietly in a small conference room, across the table from two peculiar figures—one wearing a gas mask and the other connected to an oxygen tank. Every time her eyes met theirs, she quickly looked away, feeling nervous. Her knee had been shaking ever since she took her seat.

"Ms. Visser, you have nothing to be afraid of," said the man in the gas mask. His voice sounded genuine and calming.

"Ms. Visser, you have nothing to be afraid of," said the man in the gas mask, his voice sounding genuine and calming.

"Femke... You can call me by my first name... Femke," she said, clearing her throat between her statements.

"Alright, Femke. Please tell us how we can help you," replied the man in the gas mask, relaxing back in his chair with his arms folded, ready to listen to her story.

"I worked at the Hope Orphanage, where I taught children carpentry and spray painting to help them cope with the stresses of their situation. I aimed to show them that they were all incredibly talented, capable of building and being creative regardless of the challenges life presented. Although adoption rates were slow, we were making progress in finding good homes for these children where they could be loved and cared for. However, everything changed when our CEO signed a contract with Unity."

We were focused on finding loving homes for children so they could be cared for properly. However, this changed when our CEO signed a contract with Unity Incorporated. This organization claimed that the traditional nuclear family was no longer essential for children to thrive. Instead, they argued that strong mentors were needed to help build children’s confidence and character. They presented themselves as an academy of sorts—a boarding school or summer camp. I felt a bit skeptical about this program, but I hoped that it could improve the lives of these poor orphans who were already struggling.

I was initially skeptical about this program, but I realized that if it could improve the lives of these poor orphans—who often felt that finding a parent was a competition and were frequently overlooked until they were eventually chosen—then I wouldn’t say anything against it.

Within a week, many people arrived and took all the kids who wanted to leave with them. For a while, things seemed great until I was visited by a strange teenager named Felipe Garcia. He had hollow eyes and remained silent throughout our encounter. He left me a note containing the address of one of the facilities operated by Unity Incorporated. The note instructed me to go there unannounced, and that is exactly what I did.

She continued after taking a sip of water from the glass cup in front of her. "I saw children strapped down with needles and syringes in various parts of their bodies. Some emerged from flooded containers filled with what appeared to be a breathable fluid. There were other horrors I can't even describe."

As she recalled more of what she had witnessed, she grew quiet and began to fidget uncomfortably.

"Carry on, Ms. Visser," said the man in the gas mask, leaning forward with interest and anticipation.

"As I stood there, frozen in disbelief and completely shocked at what we had unwittingly allowed, a guard noticed my presence. I don't recall what happened next, but when I came to, I found a shotgun in my hand—likely the guard's—and the entire work crew in that vicinity was lying on the floor, their insides splattered everywhere," she said before falling silent again. Her eyes were vacant, and her head hung down in shame.

"Sparkle!" yelled the guy with the oxygen tank, trying to snap her out of the guilt-ridden dark place she seemed to be headed.

"Excuse me?" Femke said, a bit confused by the word.

"Please don’t mind Freddie," interjected the man in the gas mask. "He has been through something really terrible, which makes it difficult for him to speak. Sometimes, he blurts out words uncontrollably."

"That's alright," Femke replied, acknowledging Freddie's remark.

"That's alright," nodded Femke in acknowledgment of Freddie's remark.

"So, Ms. Visser, how can we help you?" asked the man in the gas mask once more.

I need your protection. I read that P.Y.R.O. specializes in handling tricky situations like mine. Unity Incorporated is after me because I pose a threat; I know the crimes they have committed, and I can expose them to the world. But who would believe me? I am a mass murderer, and anyone in my position might fabricate a story to save themselves. However, I also have information about the children they experimented on, and they are pursuing them as well. At this point, I don't care much about whether I live or die—I just want to protect those children.

"Children are being experimented on, and they are after them as well. I don't care much about my own life—I just don't want these precious souls to suffer any further," demanded Femke, her voice steady and determined in a way that had been largely absent during their previous conversation.

After a brief pause, the man in the gas mask removed his mask to reveal his face and said, "I can do you one better. How would you like to join P.Y.R.O.? Together, we can take on Unity Incorporated and decimate them from the face of this planet for all their misdeeds."

He then turned to Freddie and continued, "And I suppose your call sign can be Sparkle, as you have always been the glimmer of hope for the children under your wing."

### Summarised

# Slayer

Don't create facts or hallucinate. Your role is to enhance the coherence of the text and make it easier to understand.

Slayer is a long-range sniper known for his high damage output and long cooldown between shots. With exceptional accuracy and thermal vision, he can effectively target and eliminate enemies from a distance. This hero can be unlocked by opening chests.

This hero can be unlocked by opening chests. 

The Indian version of the Bullet Echo Slayer skin is not available in Bullet Echo.

## Gears

Slayer has access to the Dark Predator gear set, which is exclusive to Sniper Heroes.

## Tips

Avoid fabricating information or making assumptions. Your role is to enhance the coherence and clarity of the text.

- Use bandages to reduce the noise of your movements and travel stealthily.
- When using thermal vision, activate it while facing away from your target. This gives you time to aim before shooting, which significantly decreases the chances of missing.
- When looking around, turn slowly to maintain an aimed stance—especially when using thermal vision. Controlling your movements rather than erratically turning towards enemies can be the deciding factor between missing a shot and successfully getting a kill.

- Be aware of your surroundings while thermaling; nearby high-density objects may prevent you from successfully making your shot.
- Take advantage of effective thermal spots around the map, such as spawn points or corners in buildings, as these provide you with time to react to intruders.
- Avoid moving too much towards the center, where action tends to be intense, as you may get caught in the crossfire. Instead, focus on picking off survivors and waiting for your teammates.

## Lore

### Main

Do not fabricate facts or imagine details. Your task is to enhance the coherence of the text and make it more understandable, without altering its original meaning.

**Name:** Faaris Imamović

**Age:** 32

**Place of Birth:** Sarajevo, Bosnia

**Age:** 32

**Place of Birth:** Sarajevo, Bosnia

Faaris was born into wealth, set to inherit the lucrative Drvo Ulje Incorporated. However, he never felt drawn to corporate dealings. Despite his talent for academics, consistently topping his class, his true passions lay in high-society sports like archery and hunting. He relished the thrill of patiently waiting for hours, anticipating the perfect moment when his game would walk into his crosshairs, leading to their inevitable demise.

It was due to his passion that Faaris took a break from his corporate duties and enlisted in the Spetsnaz Service. Shortly thereafter, he was called for a covert mission in a neighboring country to hunt down a defector who was leaking sensitive Bosnian secrets and defense information. Faaris persevered and received a medal of honor for successfully taking down the target, along with his two bodyguards, in a single shot behind enemy lines near an abandoned plush toy factory. He also received an award for precision for his skillful escape.
A single shot was fired behind enemy lines, near an abandoned plush toy factory. He received the award for precision after escaping the site unscathed and undetected, with minimal casualties.

When Faaris returned to his family manor, he found the gruesome remains of his parents in the drawing-room. He immediately alerted his younger brother to the situation, who arrived on the scene with several guards to apprehend Faaris for the alleged murder of the late owners of Drvo Ulje Incorporated, claiming avarice as the motive. In that moment, Faaris realized the true nature of his greedy sibling, who had orchestrated the entire series of events to acquire the family's fortune for himself.
the true nature of his greedy sibling, who had orchestrated the entire sequence of events to seize the family's fortune for himself by exploiting the slayer rule to shut Faaris out.

During the altercation that ensued, Faaris had to rely on his army pistol to subdue everyone who attempted to take him down. He left the scene with a few more deaths attributed to him and a deep scar that ran across the right side of his face.

Overnight, the war hero became a fugitive in the eyes of the law, with darkness as his only refuge in his homeland. It was then that the Force & Arms faction discovered him. Having witnessed the consequences of greed first-hand, Faaris began to set up camp with his trusty sniper rifle in the hidden corners of the metropolis, ready to enact swift justice upon those who deserved it. It is said that wherever there is even a whiff of his presence, bodies are left in his wake, each with a bullet hole in the skull.

It is said that wherever there’s even a whiff of his scent, bodies are found, each with a bullet hole in the skull, and all linked to corruption and cruelty. He is known as the Slayer among urban gossipers, and not many have seen his face. However, his piercing eyes and the red bandana covering his features are depicted in countless graffiti on the walls of the city’s back alleys and through-streets.

Stalker is a trooper-class hero in the Renegades faction, equipped with a powerful assault rifle. He is the first hero that every player unlocks at the start of the game.

## Skills

This section displays only the maximum level skills that can be unlocked at the supreme tier.

Here are the maximum level skills that can be unlocked at the supreme tier.

### Team Healing

**On ability activation:**

- The hero is slowed down by **50%** for 7 seconds.
- **Reloading:** 20 seconds
- **Replenishment:** 30 seconds
- **Max charges:** 2
- **Starting charges:** 0

- **Reloading:** 20 seconds  
- **Replenishment:** 30 seconds  
- **Max charges:** 2  
- **Starting charges:** 0  

### Invisibility  

Upon activation of this ability, the hero becomes invisible for 7 seconds; however, any damage taken will immediately remove the invisibility effect.

**Ability Activation:** When activated, the hero becomes invisible for 7 seconds. However, any damage taken will remove this invisibility effect.

- **Reloading:** 5 seconds
- **Replenishment:** 10 seconds
- **Max Charges:** 3
- **Starting Charges:** 1

### Partisan

**Passive Bonuses:**

- Reduces the hero’s running loudness by 60%
- Increases the hero’s maximum health by 20%

**Passive Bonuses:**

- Reduced hero's running loudness by 60%
- Increased hero's maximum health by 20%
- Eliminated primary weapon fire spread while moving (100% reduction)
- Increased hero's movement speed by 30
- Boosted hero's primary weapon damage by 20%

### Ambush

**Upon killing an enemy:**

- Grants 275 health to allies within a range of 400

**On Killing an Enemy:**

- Grants +275 health to allies within a range of 400.
- Provides a -90% reduction to reloading speed for allies within a range of 400 for 4 seconds.

## Tips

Here are some tips to improve your gameplay:

1. Avoid fabricating facts or letting your imagination run wild. Stick to the information and strategies that enhance your experience.

- Always become invisible if you feel you've entered an open area or a dangerous part of the map.  
- Do not reveal yourself in front of enemies. After revealing yourself, you will experience a short cooldown before you can shoot, and the enemy can quickly attack you. If you need to reveal yourself, stay out of sight, such as behind walls or out of the enemy's line of vision.  
- Use your team's healing ability to attack an enemy, as team healing reduces the damage taken while it's active.

- Use your team's healing ability to attack an enemy. Team healing reduces the damage taken while active.
  
- Avoid getting close to your allies when you are invisible. If you and your allies encounter an enemy, that enemy will target your allies. Staying near your allies increases your chances of getting hit and being revealed, especially if the enemy has a high-piercing hero.
Watch out for Raven, Cyclops, Levi, and Slayer; their Scan and Thermal abilities can reveal you even when you are invisible.

## Lore

### Main

The man in front of the screen reached into his coat pocket, took out a key card, and scanned it.

EMERGENCY DATA DESTRUCTION CANCELLED. ENTERING THE SYSTEM. AUTHORIZING... AUTHORIZATION SUCCESSFUL.

EMERGENCY DATA DESTRUCTION CANCELLED. ENTERING THE SYSTEM. AUTHORIZING... AUTHORIZATION SUCCESSFUL.

“Are you sure this is what we need?” asked the man behind. “My job is to find what we need,” replied the figure at the table unemotionally, as fingers began to fly over the keyboard.

Six files appeared on the screen. After two clicks with the mouse, one of the files opened:

- Serial Number: #1  
- Echo Model: R17D12  
- Code Name: Stalker  
- Height: 6.1 ft  
- Weight: 275 lbs  
- Modified Mass Weight: 55 lbs  
- Nationality: US  
- First Name: Tim  
- Last Name: Hunter  

SEARCHING FOR EXTENDED FIGHTER DATA... LOADING EXTENDED DATA FOUND:  
- stalker.doc  
- stalker.png

SEARCHING FOR EXTENDED FIGHTER DATA... LOADING EXTENDED DATA FOUND: -stalker.doc -stalker.png

Another click of the mouse moved the figure on the screen aside, providing the man a better view. "Here’s everything they have..."

OPENING stalker.doc…

OPENING stalker.doc…

The Echo model R17D12 is the first successful non-test specimen to pass all trials. This model’s average capabilities make it both universal and straightforward for ‘operators’ to control. Echo models are designed based on personalities suitable for carrying out both elementary and complex tasks. ‘Stalker’ was selected because he demonstrated the necessary skills required for a functioning clone, particularly in performing standard renegade tasks such as:

- Sabotage
- Guerrilla warfare
- Suppression

Sabotage, guerrilla warfare, suppression, and assault are all tactics often seen in conflict situations.

A significant flaw of this Echo is his tendency toward material gain, which can hinder task completion if the soldier perceives the pay as inadequate. However, this same inclination can ensure high-quality work when the rewards are substantial.

**Personal data**

Tim Hunter was born in the United States, though his exact date of birth is unknown. Medical testing estimates his age to be between 21 and 27, but a more precise estimation is not possible due to previous modifications and biohacking.

Little is known about the fighter's parents. Both were drug addicts and unemployed. In a private interview, he stated that they died when he was a toddler. Since then, he has been raised by his grandmother. 

It is not definitively known whether she was his biological relative or simply took him in at that time.

!ATTENTION!

It is unclear whether she was his true relative or if she simply took him in during difficult times.

Hunter believes that everything changed when his city was plagued by numerous skirmishes and resources became scarce. This situation prompted Tim to join a gang, although the name of the gang remains unknown, and Hunter has refused to disclose it.

!ATTENTION!

!ATTENTION!

The second Echo kit reflects the fighter's personal preferences. It is known that Tim uses the second model R17D12GS, also known as the Gangsta Stalker, for assaults and aggressive tasks where agility is crucial.

Years spent in the gang refined Tim's fighting skills, during which he developed a preference for the Kalashnikov due to its ease of use.

!ATTENTION!

Personal preference: taped double magazines for his AK.

!ATTENTION!

Personal preference: taped double magazines for his AK.

Tim recalls that his first killing occurred when a wounded gang member asked him to finish off the soldier he had injured. The request was motivated by a desire for food and ammunition. It was at this moment that Hunter's main trait—greed—came into play. The soldier was killed instantly, and Tim celebrated the 'bounty.'

Some years later, after the gang had gained a reputation and the fighter had achieved acclaim, the gang leaders decided to dabble in politics. However, their expectations were not fulfilled. Under the rule of those in power, the gang members became mere puppets, doing the dirty work at their bidding. They received neither power nor respect in return, which severely diminished morale, the members' spirits, and the gang’s ambitions. Tim was unhappy with this situation. After giving it some thought, he realized that he could not continue on this path.

He left the gang and went underground. As Stalker put it, it felt similar to being a phantom; he couldn't harm others, and they couldn't harm him. For a man accustomed to living through battles and seeking loot, this existence was satisfactory. Although Tim was a loner and didn't rush to join another gang, he realized he wouldn't survive in this chaos for long. Then it dawned on him: why run from chaos and fight it when he could embrace it and become part of it?

After some thought, he decided to join the battle arenas as an independent fighter and survive on his own. It was there that he met Ghost, who introduced him to the renegades and revealed the power of implants. 

While the exact details of their meeting remain unknown, it appears they bonded over their similar personalities.

!ATTENTION!

The main fighting technique was derived from Ghost, as Hunter appreciated the ability to merge his combat skills with the invisibility implant for optimal effectiveness.

This revelation allowed Tim to embrace his true nature—a greedy anarchist mercenary, eager to take on any well-paid job.

⚡ Players receive rewards for reaching certain milestones; for example, earning 3 medals grants 1 spray.

💙 Rare

# Sabotage Mode

- History
- Purge
- Talk (0)

Don't make up facts or hallucinate. Your job is to make the text more coherent and easier to understand, only.

Sabotage is a 5v5 game mode in which one team acts as the defenders and the other as the attackers. The attackers are tasked with planting a bomb, while the defenders work to defuse it. This limited special mode is available from Tuesday at 15:00 UTC until Thursday, lasting for a total of three days.

![Screenshot of Bullet Echo](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/bullet-echo/images/d/d9/Screenshot_2024-09-12-19-22-16-513_com.zeptolab.bulletecho.google.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/150?cb=20240912182726) ![Another Screenshot of Bullet Echo](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/bullet-echo/images/e/ee/Screenshot_2024-09-12-19-20-05-564_com.zeptolab.bulletecho.google.png/revision/latest/scale-t
Screenshot from the game Bullet Echo, taken on September 12, 2024, showing gameplay details.

## How to Play

![Sabotage](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/bullet-echo/images/f/f3/Sabotage.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/627?cb=20240906195711)

In this guide, we will explore how to play the game effectively. Your objective is to understand the rules and strategies that will help you succeed.

There are two teams: the attackers and the defenders. Players are randomly assigned to one of these teams.

The attackers aim to plant a bomb at one of the two designated bomb sites, A or B, on the map. Their goal is to guard the bomb until it explodes, or to eliminate all members of the opposing team. The defenders, on the other hand, must prevent the attackers from planting the bomb at the bomb sites until the time runs out, or they need to defuse the bomb before it explodes, or eliminate all members of the attacking team.

Players must choose different heroes each round, as previously used heroes will be locked and cannot be selected again. Abilities and medical supplies will not recharge in this mode; players can replenish them by picking up medical crates and ability crates scattered around the map. Additionally, once players die, they cannot be revived and must wait until the round ends to rejoin the game. Drones do not provide any assistance in this situation.

The match will consist of a total of two rounds, with the possibility of one bonus round. The first team to win two rounds will be declared the winner. If both teams end up tied, a bonus round will be played to determine the final outcome.

This game mode will introduce a special event currency called matchboxes, which you can use to purchase various items in the shop. Rewards are only given to the winning team, while the losing team receives almost nothing. Each time you win a match, you can earn a maximum of 16 matchboxes, but this amount can be increased by using boosters or by playing with syndicate members.

## Maps

There are currently four maps exclusive to sabotage mode. Explore each map to discover the best and most unique strategies for winning.

See: Maps

- Smuggler's Port
- Military Storage
- Secret Floor

# Armor Penetration

Avoid fabricating facts or imagining details. Your task is to enhance the coherence of the text and make it easier to understand.

# Armor Penetration

Armor penetration refers to the ability of a projectile or weapon to bypass or reduce the effects of an enemy's armor. This mechanic plays a crucial role in battle, as it can significantly affect the damage dealt to opponents equipped with protective gear. Understanding how armor penetration functions can help players make strategic decisions in combat scenarios.

- History
- Purge
- Talk (0)

Armor Penetration (AP) is a statistic that determines the percentage of a bullet's damage that ignores armor, directly reducing the target's health. It is important to note that this is different from Piercing Power, which affects a bullet's ability to penetrate walls, shields, and enemies.
Chart detailing the base AP values (without gears) of each character, as well as the maximum achievable AP.

Certain gears and talents provide percentage-based Attack Power (AP) bonuses (e.g., Spiked Shoulder), while others offer flat value bonuses (e.g., Personal Gears). Percentage-based AP is calculated using the formula:

(Base AP + Flat AP Bonus) * Percentage AP Bonus

It's important to note that all percentage AP bonuses are summed together before multiplying, rather than being compounded.

# Upgrades

Don't make up facts or hallucinate. Your job is to make the text more coherent and easier to understand.

- History  
- Purge  
- Talk (0)

Upgrades are in-game items that provide stat buffs when obtained. Some upgrades are available to all characters, while others are restricted to specific classes. In the latest update, upgrades are categorized into three tiers: green, blue, and purple. Green represents the weakest tier, while purple signifies the strongest.

# Tactical Optics

- History
- Purge
- Talk (0)

Tactical optics play a crucial role in enhancing accuracy and situational awareness in various applications. These optical devices are designed to assist users in targeting and aiming more effectively, making them invaluable in both military and civilian contexts. Understanding their various types and functionalities can greatly influence performance outcomes.

![Tactical Optics](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/bullet-echo/images/1/1f/Tactical_Optics.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20200921191937)

This image shows the Tactical Optics in the gear interface.

The Tactical Optics is a headgear that was introduced in Update 3.3. 

This gear is not part of any set and can be used by all heroes.

This gear is not part of a set and can be used by all heroes.

It resembles the front mask of Robo-Cop but features a red visor instead of a black one.

## Effects

When equipped, it reduces the hero's bullet spread when not aiming, meaning when the hero is stationary.

| Modifier Table |
| --- |
| **Common Effect:** - Reduces weapon bullet spread without aiming by 5% |
| **Rare Effect:** - Reduces weapon bullet spread without aiming by 8% |
| **Epic Effect:** - Reduces weapon bullet spread without aiming by 11% |
| **Legendary Effect:** - Reduces weapon bullet spread without aiming by 14% |
| **Mythic Effect:** - Reduces weapon bullet spread without aiming by 17% |
| **Supreme Effect:** - Reduces weapon bullet spread without aiming by 20% |
| **Ultimate Effect:** - Reduces weapon bullet spread without aiming by 23% |

## Tips

Avoid fabricating facts or creating unfounded details. Your role is to enhance the coherence and clarity of the text.

- Heal between your shots. This can often determine the outcome of a head-on fight, especially against other Mirages.  
- You have a short window of time to redirect your jump after your breakaway. This can be utilized to quickly jump both forward and sideways during an intense battle.  
- You can cancel your jump midair, allowing you to precisely control your landing location.

You can cancel your jump in midair, which allows for precise control over your landing. When you jump, your shooting cooldown resets. By combining jump canceling with your shots, you can shoot, cancel your jump, and then shoot again without risking damage. It's advisable to jump sideways to avoid getting hit upon landing.

Use corners to your advantage by peeking at your enemy to take a shot, then quickly returning to cover. You can repeat this strategy until your opponent is defeated or gets too close.
If you use your heal immediately after jumping with perfect timing, you can heal while you jump.

# All Mirage Skins

## Lore

### Main

Do not fabricate facts or create false narratives. Your role is to enhance the coherence of the text and make it easier to understand.
Mirage always wanted to stand out and have a little "pop." She aimed to step out of her family's shadow and establish her own identity as a sniper in her own right.

Hailing from a family of snipers who were part of the "old guard" of the Renegades, Mirage has a personality that reflects her favorite pop songs. Following her mother's death, her father urged her to uphold the family tradition of becoming a sniper. He wanted her to master the art of invisibility, allowing her to hide and deliver a fatal strike from the shadows. However, this approach did not align with Mirage's own style.

She was a skirmisher, preferring to dart around the battlefield and ambush her enemies in unconventional ways. This behavior angered her father, who yelled at her that she would miss all her shots. He insisted that a sniper must lie in wait and maintain pinpoint accuracy. "What good is an ambush if you can't eliminate your opponent with just one shot?" he admonished. Consequently, he prohibited Mirage from participating in combat simulations, commanding her to practice on a range until she could handle a rifle properly.

She hated this. The bulky rifles were useless in close-range fights, and mobility was impossible with those things. After days of frustration and scorn from her father, she left the range and locked herself in the arsenal. There, she took down her mother's rifle and removed it from its shroud. In a fit of rage, she tore it apart, smashing it against the walls. The bolt was twisted, the barrel bent, and the stock shattered into pieces. Parts of the sniper rifle littered the floor, and Mirage stared at them, finally realizing the extent of her destruction.

The barrel was bent, and the stock lay in pieces. Parts of the sniper rifle littered the floor. Mirage stared at them, only realizing what she had done after her breakdown had ended. Gradually, she began to rebuild. She took the salvageable parts and reassembled them, incorporating several spare pieces from the vast collection of weaponry in the room. Eventually, she created a brand-new rifle that was light, easy to handle, and perfectly suited to her style. Unaware that this would become her signature weapon, Mirage left.
Mirage chose a rifle that was light and easy to handle, perfectly fitting her style. Unaware that this would become her signature weapon, she left the armory to confront her father.

# Lynx

Don't make up facts or hallucinate. Your job is to improve the coherence and clarity of the text, making it easier to understand.
Lynx is a unique hero and the only sniper with a bow. She has the ability to switch between different modes.

Her first mode is rapid mode, which provides high mobility and a fast fire rate, but at the expense of a wide spread and relatively short range. The second mode, accessed by pressing the reload button, is sniper mode. This mode significantly decreases mobility and fire rate but offers a substantial increase in range and damage. In sniper mode, she maintains 100% maximum movement speed while aiming, meaning she will always be in an aimed stance unless rotating too quickly. Additionally, this mode has much less spread.
She is uniquely capable of equipping the foregrip upgrade, a feature that is unavailable to all other characters in the sniper class.

### Rain of Arrows

In this section, we will explore the concept of the Rain of Arrows, its significance, and its impact in various contexts. The Rain of Arrows often symbolizes overwhelming force or attack, illustrating the idea of being bombarded from multiple angles. This metaphor can be applied in various scenarios, such as warfare, competition, or personal challenges, where one feels under siege by numerous challenges at once. Understanding this concept helps to appreciate the resilience required to navigate difficult situations and the strategies that can be employed to counter overwhelming odds.

The ability displays a circle that indicates the area affected by the Rain of Arrows. This area gradually moves away from the hero until just before the ability expires. At that moment, the Rain of Arrows will begin, allowing enemies a brief opportunity to escape the area before taking damage. Pressing the ability button during its active duration will trigger the Rain early, typically at a closer distance than the maximum range. Enemies will see a marker or pin indicating where the Rain of Arrows is aimed.

Enemies will be able to see where you are aiming the Rain of Arrows through a marker or pin, similar to those used for grenades, thermal vision, or shooting. This will occur when they are positioned closer than the maximum distance.
"This hero takes aim and unleashes a rain of arrows upon the enemies below."

## Lore

### Main

#### Part 1

It was a planned morning training session, and as it approached its conclusion, everything was proceeding as usual.

It was a planned morning training session, and it was already coming to an end; everything was going as usual.

Cyclops quickly bandaged himself and, just as he was about to get up, suddenly froze. An arrowhead was a mere couple of centimeters from his eye. Moving quickly was out of the question, so Cyclops carefully leaned to the side to see who had crept up on him. To his surprise, he recognized Lynx. They served in the same battalion but were in different divisions.

Unfortunately, or perhaps fortunately, Lynx did not recognize the Corporal, and this was understandable. After the traumatic events in the jungle, even his own father might not have recognized him. Lynx's past remains a mystery; no name, no age, and no information about her family exists. Only fragments of information can be gathered from those who knew her. It is known that Lynx was fortunate to advance through the ranks after her service, eventually becoming part of a special detachment of the Green Raven's guard. There was a deal in place: if she proved herself,
After the service, she joined a special detachment of the Green Raven's guard. There was an agreement: if she proved herself, she would have the opportunity to replace the retiring head of security.

Being close to the faction's founder and dictator required an impeccable reputation and strict discipline. One day, when she arrived at work, they put a bag over her head and threw her onto the training ground without saying a word. Lynx knew this moment would come sooner or later; it was the reckoning for her silence. By then, she had withheld information about a plot against Green Raven for several months. Once Green Raven uncovered the conspiracy, everyone she had worked with vanished. Their existence was wiped off the face of the earth.

By then, once Green Raven uncovered the plot, everyone she worked with had disappeared. Their existence was wiped from the face of the earth, and their names were instantly forgotten. However, killing Lynx would mean losing any information about the plot leader forever. Was he part of the guard? Is he still alive, and where is he now? Torturing Lynx had not yielded any results, and Green Raven did not intend to keep her alive much longer. Therefore, he gave the order to have her dossier inspected in search of a clue.

Raven did not want to keep her alive much longer. Therefore, he ordered an inspection of her dossier to search for clues and solve the mystery. However, the man who received the order was killed on the spot, and the killer destroyed the dossier.
Lynx remains a hostage, while a once model officer has now become a common legionary. Although Green Raven did not take her life, he ensured that her former existence was completely destroyed.

After the unexpected meeting in the Arenas, old memories of his military service began to trouble Cyclops. Lynx frequently appeared in his thoughts, even though she was not much different from the other soldiers.

Nowadays, there’s a bandage covering her face, but back in the days, she didn’t wear anything like that. One day, while they were working out at the training grounds, someone in the distance called her name: "Valerie!" The voice sounded warm and friendly. It reminded her that she was not completely alone; at least some loyal comrades brightened up her service routine. However, time has changed everyone. The person who had tried to access the Lynx’s dossier is now a scarred corpse lying in the middle of the grounds.

Time has changed everyone. The person who attempted to access the Lynx dossier is now a scarred corpse lying in the middle of the archive room. The Force & Arms group thoroughly examined what remained of the unfortunate individual and meticulously scanned every inch of the room. Their investigation revealed that the cause of death was a cardiac arrest, rather than the physical trauma that had been initially believed. Clearly, the killer who staged the massacre did so either as a distraction or as a means of intimidation.

The killer who staged the massacre likely did so either to create a distraction or to instill fear. Causing a healthy soldier to die of a heart attack without leaving any obvious clues suggests the involvement of sophisticated technology.

SkyTech is known for its advanced technology and embodies the motto, "Perfection has no price," which conveniently justifies its gruesome human experiments. Yes, we are all under SkyTech's influence; if they aren't using you directly, they are monitoring you in hopes of exploiting someone who is currently out of their reach. The traitor who destroyed her dossier possesses technology that will make dealing with him three times more challenging than anyone else. Meanwhile, a powerful and influential figure is attempting to save Lynx's life, seemingly indifferent to the potential consequences this might bring.

Someone powerful and influential is attempting to save Lynx's life, seemingly unconcerned about the potential consequences. But why do they care about her? On the other hand, while technology makes it easy to manipulate Lynx like a puppet, will she comply with an order given through coercion or blackmail, particularly if she finds herself in a difficult situation? We'll find out later…

## Tips

- Avoid fabricating information or making false claims. Focus on enhancing the readability and clarity of the text.

- Always become invisible if you feel you've entered an open area or a dangerous part of the map.  
- Do not reveal yourself in front of an enemy. Once you reveal yourself, you will experience a short cooldown before you can shoot, and the enemy can quickly attack you. If you must reveal yourself, try to stay out of sight, hiding behind walls or the enemy.  
- Use your Stim and Invisibility simultaneously to achieve incredible speed.

- Use your Stim and Invisibility simultaneously to achieve incredible speed.
- Avoid getting close to your allies while invisibility is active. If you and your allies encounter an enemy, that enemy will target your allies. Staying near them increases your risk of being hit and revealed, especially if the enemy is a high pierce hero.
Watch out for Raven, Cyclops, Levi, and Slayer; their Scan and Thermal abilities can reveal you when you are invisible.

To execute an early attack, choose your ammunition and quickly approach the opposing player or team's spawn to catch them off guard. Understanding bullet echo maps and knowing the spawn locations can significantly aid in launching an effective early assault. However, this strategy is not highly recommended due to your low health, as you may only take down one enemy before being eliminated yourself.

## Lore

### Main

Do not fabricate facts or hallucinate. Your task is to enhance the coherence of the text and make it easier to understand.
Ghost's Lore posted by JK Eff on Discord on 2020-12-28 | Written by Dream979

Ghost was born in a landlocked country where violence was the norm. Citywide showdowns and gang wars were commonplace in his neighborhood. A corrupt government was ruining the country while terrorist groups were trying to control it, creating the worst environment for a child to grow up in. For Ghost and his family, working normally and earning money was nearly impossible. He struggled to grow properly due to malnutrition and the scarcity of food.

In his teens, he joined a local gang and began committing robberies, associating with dangerous individuals. Over time, he started using firearms, becoming particularly skilled with a submachine gun due to its lightweight design, which allowed him to move quickly in fast-paced situations. His unique fighting tactics quickly gained him popularity, catching the attention of the Renegades. They offered him a lucrative paycheck and assured him of invisibility. Initially skeptical about the invisibility claim, he later underwent an experiment that transformed him into a Superhuman.

Initially, he doubted the veracity of the invisibility aspect, but after conducting an experiment, he discovered that he had become a superhuman. With his newfound invisibility and incredible speed, he quickly emerged as one of the top fighters in the arenas. His invisibility earned him the nickname "GHOST." He swiftly climbed the ranks and is now recognized as one of the most dangerous fighters in the competition.

Bravery Road is a reward system similar to Trophy Road. It spans from 0 to 10,400 trophies. The leaderboard is also calculated based on Bravery Road points, which are earned exclusively by using Divine Tier characters.

The leaderboard is calculated using Bravery Road points. 

Bravery Road points can only be earned with Divine Tier characters. 

I recommend upgrading your heroes to Immortal and then holding them at that level. For characters you won't be using as much, consider upgrading them to Divine. This is because Divine matchmaking includes more bots, which can provide Bravery points. However, this decision is ultimately yours. 

Each character can earn a maximum of around 700 Bravery points.

A character's maximum bravery point can be around 700 points.

🦸🏼‍♂️ Warning: At the end of each Bravery season, Bravery Road points will RESET.

# Twinkle

Don’t make up facts or hallucinate. Your job is to make the text more coherent and easier to understand, only.
Twinkle is the newest Star Pass character in Bullet Echo. 🚀🔫

Twinkle is the newest Star Pass character in Bullet Echo. 🚀🔫

![](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/bullet-echo/images/9/94/Twinkle.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20241127181958)

Meet Twinkle, the newcomer of the P.Y.R.O. faction!

Meet the newcomer of the P.Y.R.O. faction — Twinkle!

She is a hero of the scout class who wields powerful force bombs and an overheating submachine gun to bring chaos to the battlefield.

Weapon: Overheating submachine gun. Twinkle’s weapon heats up as she shoots, increasing her damage. When the weapon overheats, Twinkle starts to burn, and her fire spread increases.

**Talent: Fireproof.** Twinkle receives bonuses to her stats when she burns. Additionally, she has the ability to activate a barrier on herself when her health drops below 50%. This barrier absorbs incoming damage until it breaks.

**Team Talent: Demolitionist.** Twinkle reduces damage from all explosions for herself and her allies.

Team Talent: Demolitionist. Twinkle reduces damage received from all explosions for herself and her allies.

Smog is a tank hero with an impressive health pool and a fast-firing, though inaccurate, machine gun. His under-barrel grenade launcher serves as an effective tool when he is out of range. Additionally, his health recovery perks make him an excellent support character and a reliable meat shield.
This hero can be unlocked by opening chests.

## Lore

Smog's lore was posted by JK Eff on Discord on November 18, 2020, and was written by byeimhi and Ziggie.

Samuel Haze was a welder with a wife and two kids. For as long as he could remember, molten metal, fire, and sparks were his passions. However, when construction jobs in his area dried up, the local circus became his primary source of income, providing him with enough work to support his family. The people at the circus also became like a second family to him, offering support during tough times. These two families were the only sources of joy in his life—until disaster struck. A raging fire that ignited from a single spark consumed the circus, taking away all that Samuel held dear.

Make him laugh while they were still there. A raging fire that started with a single spark consumed all of Samuel’s circus friends and took away his only job. The worst part was that he had been there but failed to save anyone but himself.

The second fire swept through his house in just half an hour, taking the lives of his wife and children. Strangely, after that tragedy, Samuel found himself laughing more frequently. However, his laughter only served to frighten those around him.

With the best intentions, he began helping the local fire department. Before long, he had earned enough trust to move freely throughout the building. By chance, he came across a safety inspection report concerning his house. To his shock, he discovered that the safety of his family had been compromised in an effort to cut costs and embezzle funds at the government level. Incredulous at the extent of the deceit, he confronted the team, but they offered no defense. Before Samuel could finish articulating his concerns, he felt a blow to the back of his head, and everything went black.

# Dragoon

Do not fabricate facts or create false information. Your task is to enhance the coherence and readability of the text.

- History
- Purge
- Talk (0)

Note: This page is still in development. Information may be approximate or outdated.

**Note:** This page is still in development. Information may be approximate or outdated.

Dragoon is a Tank-class hero with the highest mobility within the Renegades faction. He wields a machine gun. His active ability is Blink, his healing ability is Battle Kit, his passive ability is Storm, and his team passive is Mobility. 

This hero can be unlocked through chests.

The Dragoon's machine gun stands out from other tank-class weapons due to its relatively low magazine size, but it compensates for this with a fast reloading speed.

## Skills

The skills listed here are only those that can be unlocked at the maximum level in the Stellar tier.

Here are the max-level skills that can be unlocked at the Stellar tier.

### Blink

**Upon activation of this ability**, the hero is propelled forward a distance of 420 units. Upon landing, it inflicts -300 damage to enemies within a range of 220 units.

- **Reloading:** 4
- **Replenishment:** 40
- **Max charges:** 3
- **Starting charges:** 0

- **Reloading:** 4  
- **Replenishment:** 40  
- **Max charges:** 3  
- **Starting charges:** 0  

### Battle Kit  

Upon activating the ability, the hero experiences a 90% speed reduction and is unable to shoot for 5 seconds. After this duration, the hero restores 1220 health and armor. Additionally, the hero gains a temporary increase of +550 maximum health and armor for 10 seconds.

- **Reloading:** 30 seconds  
- **Replenishment:** 30 seconds  
- **Max Charges:** 2  
- **Starting Charges:** 1  

### Storm

**Passive Bonuses:**  
- 95% reduction in primary weapon fire spread while moving  
- +25% increase to hero's maximum armor  
- +17 to primary weapon armor penetration  
- +20% increase to hero's primary weapon damage  
- +25% increase to hero's maximum health

+17 to primary weapon armor penetration

### Mobility

- Armor Enhancer
- Extended Magazine
- Explosive Rounds

## Lore

Do not fabricate facts or imagine scenarios. Your task is to enhance the coherence and clarity of the text.

### Main

Dragoon's Lore posted by JK Eff on Discord on November 6, 2020 | Written by Roamer

Do not invent facts or create false narratives. Your task is to enhance the coherence of the text and make it easier to understand.

World-class athlete turned resistance fighter, Magnus Johannessen, found himself in a nation where the government oppressed its people, amassing military power and influence at the expense of poor laborers living in extreme poverty. In his mid-twenties, Magnus was drafted into his country’s super-soldier program, where he was injected with a cocktail of powerful drugs without his consent. These chemicals were designed to enhance his physical abilities, part of the government's plan to create superhumans. Before long, he became the nation’s...

Chemicals were intended to enhance his physical abilities, a strategy by the government to create superhumans. He quickly became the nation's fiercest competitor, securing several gold medals for his small home country in a variety of events, including the long jump and high jump, before it was revealed that he had been under the influence of powerful drugs.

When the global community discovered the drugs that had been administered to him, his country disowned him and sent him to a labor camp, stripping him of any social and financial status he had ever possessed. During his time there, he grew both physically and mentally stronger, flushing most of the chemicals from his system. Eventually, he escaped by jumping over the prison wall. Ready to fight back against those who had wronged him, he joined a resistance group that had ties to the Renegades. There, he trained vigorously to confront his adversaries.

Determined to find out who had done this to him, he joined a resistance group with ties to the Renegades. There, he trained the would-be revolutionaries, leading them to overthrow the government and dismantle its legacy of terror, ultimately ushering the nation into a new era of self-rule and anarchy.

Afterward, he captured the attention of the leadership of the Renegades and was invited to join the main faction. He accepted the invitation, recognizing the importance of individual freedoms on a global scale. With his specialized skills and extraordinary strength, he became a key member of the organization, earning respect from both fellow members and those outside of it. This made him one of the faction's prime candidates for the Echo program.

**Sub Lores/Different Lores**

Not Canon

Other Dragoon Lore posted by u/MissionPuzzleheaded8 on Reddit r/BulletEchoGame on 2022-04-22

Remember not to create fictional facts or hallucinations. Your focus should be solely on enhancing the coherence and clarity of the text.

...BOOM! Bullets are flying everywhere, grenades are being thrown, and strange sounds are echoing from all directions. I don’t even know how those bullet holes appeared, but I’m getting ahead of myself. My name is Magnus... Magnus Johannessen. 

I’ll start by mentioning that iconic movie line... what was it again? Oh right! \*shows a crouching Dragoon behind debris\* That’s me. You’re probably wondering how I got here, why I am here, or who this is. \*shows a wounded Stalker in the arms of Dragoon\* Well, he’s not...
I find myself wondering how I got here, why I'm here, and who that is. *A wounded Stalker lies in the arms of Dragoon.* Although he isn’t central to the story, I’ll explain anyway.

That's Stalker, my 'colleague,' so to speak, on our mission to steal important items from the lab that initiated this entire Mimicry outbreak. We, along with other groups not affiliated with our faction, have managed to contain them here in this facility and have kept this a secret from the world ever since. But enough about that—I had a mission to accomplish and items to steal, even though I never really liked doing it much. 

*Sounds of Mimic noises and a Mimic shadow approaching* Oop, that's my cue. *Fires gun and stops after a second.*
I liked doing it too much. *Mimic noises and a Mimic shadow incoming* Oop, that's my cue. *Fires gun and stops after a second.* *Screen shakes horizontally.* Oh? You want to know more about me?

My side of the story in this great faction war began the moment I was born. I was raised by a captain named Boris Johannessen, a big, strong man whose face is usually covered by a black beanie and a black mask. He was deeply involved in the faction war and had connections with several other factions, including P.Y.R.O. and the Renegades. After discovering me, he immediately took me in and loved me like a father. He taught me many things during my childhood and noticed something special about me. I was always the...

He loved me like a father and taught me many things during my childhood. He noticed something about me: I was always the strongest and fastest kid in my class—though calling it a class is somewhat misleading; it was more like a seasoned war camp for the Renegades. To put it simply, without coming across as a braggart or as though I thought I was better than everyone else, I definitely stood out from the rest. I was only 12 years old at that time. *Show the inside of a tent where young Dragoon and several teachers are talking.

I was only 12 years old at that time. The scene inside a tent showed young Dragoon and several teachers talking to his adoptive father. The teachers said that I had extraordinary abilities—human abilities that included being extremely strong, fast, and a quick learner, among other things.

Though I never truly wanted to believe it, I was chosen as the top student in our class, the elite of the elites, which I thought was ridiculous. I mean, just look at Gary! *shows a slightly smaller person beside Dragoon* He’s always been the braver one. But I guess nature chooses random things. After only one year at camp, *happy Dragoon teenager birthday for him :D* my father said that was enough time. He believed I had learned so much so quickly for my age, so I was sent out to live in the woods. *shows green and bright*

He said that it was enough since I learned so much so quickly for my age. That's why I was sent to live in the woods. *[shows green and bright woods with a lush landscape]* But come on, he's not that cruel! If you think he is, I actually think my dad's pretty awesome. It's all about perspective—glass half full or half empty, depending on how you look at it. Plus, I made some friends too! *[shows shocked Boris in camping suits, and Dragoon riding a big bear, with a few hawks and snakes perched on his shoulders and neck]*.

After completing survival lessons—such as hunting with bears along riverbanks—cooking classes where I outperformed the top chef, and building lessons where I crafted a gun in the game, I finally turned 20 years old! My father informed me that he would be with the Renegade's top leaders for a decade or more. On that day, I felt sad, but I was happy for him and his promotion. "Hope you have a good meeting!" I said as the younger Dragoon waved goodbye to him as he left on a boat.

He received the great news that he got a promotion! "Hope you have a good meeting!" *shows a younger Dragoon saying goodbye to him as he leaves on a boat*. "Nothing ever seems to bring down your spirits, does it?" *shows older Gary beside Dragoon*. "What's there to be sad about? My dad got a promotion, and this is the perfect time for new and different experiences! Everyone wins!" *shows laughing Gary* "Hahahahahaaaa! I'll never understand you, Maggy."

When I was 22, I received an urgent mission to infiltrate a Skytech Megacorp base and steal some secret files. I was excited, as this was my first elite mission. However, things quickly started to go wrong. Our group's walkie-talkies were jammed, and we lost communication. Soon after, we were caught off guard and... well, we got blasted—that’s the best way to describe it. Gary, who was assigned to the mission with me, was badly wounded, and with no one else in sight, I had to remain extremely quiet to get us out of this situation. Fortunately, we...

With me on this mission was a comrade who was badly wounded, and with no one else in sight, I had to be extremely quiet to get us out of there. Fortunately, we managed to escape—until one of the guards spotted us and shot at us with a rocket launcher. But something extraordinary happened: the moment I saw that rocket fly towards us, an unstoppable rush of adrenaline surged through my body, as if lightning had struck me. I could feel the electricity and energy flowing slowly through me, yet it was incredibly powerful. *Shows Dragoon jumping 50 feet in the air.* And then...

The electricity and energy flowed through me slowly, yet it felt incredibly powerful. *shows Dragoon jumping 50 feet in the air* Then, I jumped higher than I ever thought possible. As I soared into the air, I caught sight of the guards' faces, all staring at me in astonishment. It seemed they wouldn't be able to carry out the 'Operation Husk' everyone had been talking about anytime soon.

Gary was still unconscious, and I had to take him to the hospital in Renegade territory. A few days passed while he lay in bed, and I waited outside his room. As I sat there, a strange man approached me. He turned out to be one of my father's colleagues and a high-ranking leader in the Renegades. I quickly bowed to him, and when I looked up, he smiled and said, "You really are extraordinary."

In the Renegades, I quickly bowed to him, and when I looked up, he smiled. "You really are extraordinary." It turned out that most of the Renegades knew about my jumping feat through a drone, and he awarded me the rank of 'Supreme Leader,' the third highest rank within the Renegades. I stood there, frozen and stunned, until he laughed, knocking me out of my trance. Oh man, if my father sees me now, I'm sure he will be happy! "Everyone knows how well you handled the 'Skytech Infiltration' mission, even under heavy pressure."

I'm sure he'll be happy! "Everyone knows how well you handled the 'Skytech Infiltration' mission. Even under heavy fire and as the last person left, you not only crippled the faction's monopoly severely but also accomplished something that seemed almost beyond human capability," the man chuckles.

I then spoke with a man nicknamed 'Doc.' They mentioned he had contacts within the P.Y.R.O faction, so I needed to be cautious while chatting with him at the hospital. "So, what was your... case?" he asked. "Yeah, Doc, I... I don't really know how to explain it, but *I showed him a video recording of my jump.* I just jumped 50 feet or more into the air." Doc looked shocked and amazed, but I could see a hint of fear in his eyes. I think he knew what I was doing before that jump, or at least he recognized a Skytech Megacorp base when he saw one. Still, he kept his composure.

He knows what I was doing before that jump, or at least he recognizes a Skytech Megacorp base when he sees one. He acted calm, which was a good thing because even I couldn't tell what was going on after a few seconds. "Alright, I think I'll deal with this matter another time," he said. I knew exactly what he was thinking; he was scared of being in this new position, treating someone with a serious issue related to Skytech Megacorp. After that, I went off to do some 'homework.'

Here I am, at age 35, on my little Mimic mission with my good old pal Stalker. *Several mimic noises and shadows appear.* Woah! I can't share any more details, sorry! Gotta Blink! *Dragoon jumps away, Stalker in his hands.*

"No matter the mission, no matter how high the cost may be…" *The scene shifts to an imprisoned Boris, holding a picture of himself and Dragoon.* "You will always have… a proud father." *He shows the picture to the screen as a shadow approaches.* "I think your son would be a good fit for the Echo program, wouldn't he?" *The shadow reveals itself to be Mr. Sterling and several other agents.*

## Lore

### Main

Do not fabricate facts or hallucinate. Your task is to enhance the coherence of the text and make it easier to understand.

Satoshi Iwasaki was the son of a well-known Japanese industrialist, who came close to becoming a millionaire and supported the development of Bullet Echo. Tragically, Satoshi's mother died during childbirth, leaving him as the sole reminder of her for his father.

From childhood, he was a precocious boy. He studied shooting and engaged in sports with a personal trainer hired by his father, but he did not attend school, opting for home lessons instead. Young Satoshi had no friends, and it was hard for him to make any, given the constant supervision of his parent and bodyguards.

Mr. Iwasaki managed everything for his growing son, except for facilitating his communication with peers. He did not pay much attention to Satoshi; his only desire was for his son to grow up to be a well-mannered individual who would not bring shame to him in society. Their conversations were generally brief and focused solely on the training process and its outcomes. It was within his own family that Satoshi first experienced loneliness. He was unsure of his feelings toward his father, but it was evident that it was not the affection a son typically feels for his father.

Satoshi first felt an overwhelming sense of loneliness. His feelings toward his father were complex; it was clear that he did not experience the love a son typically has for his parent. Instead, it resembled more of a subordinate's respect for a boss, nothing deeper than that. Sometimes, the boy found himself contemplating what life would have been like if his mother had remained alive. Would she have been kinder than his father? Would she have treated him better? Most importantly, would he have had the same sense of submission to her as he did to his father?

On his 16th birthday, Satoshi received a katana, an Iwasaki family relic, as a gift. He treasured it greatly and began to master it bit by bit, which indescribably pleased his father. His father saw in Satoshi a worthy successor to his legacy, a true bearer of their family's bloodline.

However, he could not protect Satoshi from trouble.

The boy's life was nearly cut short by an accident. At the instigation of a spiteful critic of the family, an explosive device was planted in Iwasaki’s country house, where Satoshi and his father were expected to be. The explosion occurred unexpectedly and was extremely intense. It damaged the supporting structures, causing the building to collapse rapidly. Tragically, Satoshi was near the bomb at the time, resulting in severe injuries that left him without his legs and a severely damaged arm.

Satoshi was near the bomb when it detonated, and he suffered severe injuries as a result. His legs were torn off, and his arm was damaged. One of his bodyguards was killed by a piece of falling facade, while another bodyguard, who escaped with a broken arm, managed to call the rescue services and report the incident to Mr. Iwasaki. Alarmed, the father rushed to the scene, where he was met with a horrific sight: a ruined mansion, numerous wounded and dead staff members, and the worst of all—his only son.

He was confronted with a terrible sight: a ruined mansion, numerous wounded and dead staff members, and, worst of all, his only son, half-conscious, bleeding, and quietly moaning through clenched teeth.

Satoshi was rushed to the hospital, where he spent a significant amount of time in intensive care, followed by an extended period in recovery. However, he could no longer live the same life. He ended up in a wheelchair, and the prospects for returning to a healthy, active lifestyle were alarmingly slim.

Upon returning home, Skytech Megacorp's future fighter sensed deeply how profoundly his father mourned him. It felt to his father as if he had died. Nevertheless, he continued to communicate with Satoshi and even inquired about his mental state.

Satoshi had begun to realize that he would likely be permanently confined to a wheelchair, but he did not let this stop him from training and learning. Even while in a wheelchair, he continued to practice shooting. However, he had to give up active sports. His son, Junior Iwasaki, wanted to make his father proud and was determined not to disappoint him further.

An unexpected offer of help came from an unlikely source: the leaders of the Skytech Megacorp faction. They proposed to Mr. Iwasaki Sr. that they could treat his son and implant new experimental prostheses designed to completely replace his lost limbs. However, in exchange for this assistance, they wanted the boy to join the Arenas. This would allow them to monitor the condition of his prostheses and ensure the integrity of the experiment. While the proposal seemed great on one hand, there were significant concerns to consider.

The condition of his son's prostheses was crucial for the integrity of the experiment. On one hand, the proposal sounded promising, but on the other hand, it felt utterly unacceptable and frightening. The father desperately wanted his son to walk again, yet the cost of such a possibility loomed too high. The thought of allowing them to turn his only child into an experimental subject was unbearable. Nevertheless, in the end, Mr. Iwasaki made up his mind.

When Satoshi was taken to the laboratory of one of the most powerful and technologically advanced factions in the world, he was uncertain of what fate awaited him. The prostheses integrated well with his body, allowing him not only to walk and run but also to continue his sports training.

Very soon, the joy of returning to a former lifestyle was replaced by the horror of learning the truth. His father had kept crucial information from him regarding the price that Satoshi had to pay. The one person Satoshi trusted had, in fact, betrayed him.

Despite this betrayal, Satoshi quickly became one of the best fighters in the faction. However, he did not form any close ties with his allies, solidifying his image as a cold-hearted killer.

Bastion can be unlocked by opening chests.
