## Lore

### Main
    
Ensure that the information presented is accurate and factual. Your role is to enhance the coherence of the text, making it clearer and easier to understand.
Bastion's Story, posted by JK Eff on Discord on February 9, 2021, is written by Дат-Минь Нгуен.

He used to be a guard, an ordinary man seen at the entrances of various buildings within the corporation. What transformed him into the person we know today? It was his unwavering motto: "To live and protect the lives of family and friends." He began working for the corporation to afford treatments for his relatives. Driven by a desire to save his best friend from the rumored pain and danger of life-threatening situations, he signed up for testing exoskeletons. Unfortunately, those rumors proved to be true; information leaks revealed that some workers were at risk.

From the rumored pain and danger to life, it became clear that these were not mere rumors, but information leaks that resulted in some workers being fired. The first prototypes of the hydraulic drive armor were, to put it mildly, failures. The movements of the armor parts caused broken bones, shattered joints, and pierced bodies. Blood from the wounds short-circuited the electronics. It could take several days to pry the armor off a person. The scientists did not anticipate that a man who had lost so much blood would be rendered unconscious from the pain and internal injuries.

The scientists were surprised to find that the man, who had lost a significant amount of blood and was unconscious due to pain and internal bleeding, still had a pulse. Remarkably, he managed to recover quickly. After 10 days of work—though 3 of those days were spent in a coma due to this 'work injury'—he was able to finance his younger brother’s treatment.

He spent years in the experimental arms lab, keeping the corporation’s newest technologies a secret to avoid being fired and to protect his colleagues from taking his place. During this time, armor was maimed and crashed, shields failed, glitched, and even shut off the systems, affecting the armor and the minigun. However, when the tests finally proved successful, the corporation introduced Bastion—a fighter as tenacious as an armored tank, equipped with substantial firepower, and capable of ignoring pain like a machine, driven by necessity. He knew he had to be...

Bastion moved like a tank, armed with the firepower of an armored vehicle, forcing himself to ignore the pain, much like a machine operates out of necessity. He understood the importance of caution on the battlefield, but he was unaware that his true enemies were the ones fighting beside him. The corporation’s mercenaries fought not only for money but also for their own survival, betraying him at every opportunity. Yet, each time a traitor sought to undermine him, they ultimately lost everything while Bastion endured. He now regretted choosing the corporation and placing his trust in fighters who did not deserve it. But he didn’t allow those regrets to consume him.

He survived, but he regrets choosing the corporation and trusting fighters who did not deserve that trust. However, he does not regret protecting others, as that choice has always saved his life. He resisted joining the Arenas because, despite the uselessness, stupidity, treachery, and even touchiness he observed among most mercenaries—whom he believed them to be—his own brother was one of them, and he was determined to repay the debt. Tragically, his brother was killed in a fight, and Bastion lost the last person he had vowed to protect.
He was determined to repay the debt. After his brother was killed in a fight, Bastion lost the last person he had protected, leaving him without the meaning in his life.

It was at that moment that he joined the Arenas. Initially seeking death, he unexpectedly discovered like-minded fighters and friends who were deserving of his protection. Through this journey, he not only gained the power to defend others but also found the will to continue living.

Also, I thought Bastion was related to Stalker since both characters share the same pink Mohawk, lol. I'm really sad to hear about Bastion's unfortunate backstory; however, it makes me even prouder of my powerhouse character.

# Hero Levels and Skill Levels

# Hero Levels and Skill Levels

Hero levels and skill levels are essential aspects of gameplay that contribute to a character's strength and capabilities. Understanding how these levels work can significantly enhance your performance in the game. 

Hero levels indicate the overall progress and power of a character, while skill levels reflect the proficiency in specific abilities. Both levels can be improved through various means, such as completing quests or participating in battles. 

These enhancements allow players to strategize better and adapt their gameplay to meet challenges effectively. By focusing on upgrading both hero and skill levels, players can maximize their potential and enjoy a more rewarding gaming experience.

## Hero Levels

Ensure the information is accurate and avoid fabricating details. Your focus should be on enhancing the text's coherence and clarity.
In this list, I will present all the hero levels along with the maximum number of cards and coins needed for leveling up.

| **Celestial** | Level 70-80 | Damage: 955 | Score: 172,800 |
| **Stellar** | Level 80-85 | Damage: 430 | Score: 163,750 |
| **Immortal** | Level 85-90 (max) | Damage: 450 | Score: 209,250 |
| **Divine** | Level Beyond | Total Damage: 3,299 | Total Score: 862,650 |

## Skills

Heroes possess four skills, and to continue upgrading these skills, they must reach specific levels.

| Skill Level | Hero Level | Baterries  |
| ----------- | ---------- | ---------- |
| Level 1     | Rare       | 0          |
| Level 2     | Rare       | 40         |
| Level 3     | Rare       | 60         |
| Level 4     | Rare       | 75         |
| Level 5     | Rare       | 100        |
| Level 6     | Epic       | 150        |
| Level 7     | Epic       | 200        |
| Level 8     | Epic       | 300        |
| Level 9     | Legendary  | 400        |
| Level 10    | Legendary  | 500        |
| Level 11    | Legendary  | 750        |
| Level 12    | Mythic     | 1,000      |

| Level 10 | Rarity: Legendary | Batteries: 500   |
| Level 11 | Rarity: Legendary | Batteries: 750   |
| Level 12 | Rarity: Mythic    | Batteries: 1,000 |
| Level 13 | Rarity: Mythic    | Batteries: 1,250 |
| Level 14 | Rarity: Supreme   | Batteries: 1,500 |
| Level 15 | Rarity: Ultimate   | Batteries: 2,000 |
| Level 16 | Rarity: Celestial | Batteries: 2,500 |
| Level 17 | Rarity: Celestial | Batteries: 3,250 |
| Level 18 | Rarity: Stellar   | Batteries: 4,500 |
| **Total Batteries**: 18,575 |

The table above outlines the requirements for upgrading a single skill to Level 18. To upgrade all four skills to Level 18, the hero needs a total of 74,300 batteries.

## Lore

Name: Carolina Bragits

Age: 24

Place of Birth: Sibut, Central African Republic (CAR).

Destiny's life was shaped by a harsh reality: she was born in one of the world's poorest and most dangerous countries into the Giglio Bragits family, known for their involvement in drug and arms dealing. As a child, she suffered abuse at the hands of her older brothers. At the age of 10, she killed her brother Masigno with a nail gun she discovered in her father's shed, managing to shift the blame to her other brother, Fit. As a consequence, Fit was banished from the family and forced to live on the streets, never to be seen again. By the time she turned 14, Destiny had mastered and perfected her shooting skills.

Later, he was banished from the family and forced to live on the streets, never to be seen again. By the age of 14, she had mastered and perfected her shooting skills, as well as her abilities in throwing knives and carving wood.

Following her family's trade, she began working at an early age and, by 16, was involved in street shootouts and illegal arms deals. During one attack on her family, her parents were killed, and Carolina was kidnapped and later sold to Somalian pirates. She became a favorite of the pirate leader, earning the nickname 'Malaggii,' which means 'Angel' in Somali. As one of the most cruel and dangerous pirates in history, she is hunted by many special forces for her involvement in killings, arms and human trafficking, and drug deals.

One of the most dangerous pirates in history, she is pursued by numerous special forces for her involvement in killings, arms and human trafficking, and drug deals. The reasons behind her joining Skytech remain a mystery, as she was reportedly missing after the last pirate raid.

The Silver Surfer is a complex character in the Marvel Universe. Originally named Norrin Radd, he hails from the planet Zenn-La. To save his world from Galactus, a powerful cosmic entity that consumes planets, Norrin Radd became the Silver Surfer, pledging to serve Galactus as his herald. 

With the ability to travel faster than light and manipulate energy, the Silver Surfer searches for planets for Galactus to consume. Despite his role, he holds a deep sense of morality and often struggles with his identity and the consequences of his actions. 

Over the years, the Silver Surfer has played significant roles in various storylines, interacting with numerous heroes and villains across the Marvel Universe. His journey often explores themes of sacrifice, redemption, and the quest for freedom.

Levi is a unique hero that can be unlocked from the leagues. She wields a high-powered assault rifle with a medium rate of fire. Her special ability allows her to see through walls and shoot through them, although this comes with a reduced movement speed. For healing, she utilizes Team Healing, and her first passive ability is called Huntress. Additionally, her team passive ability is Stun.

You can unlock this hero by opening chests or by advancing past Mossy Bronze II in the Hero Championships.
This hero can be unlocked either by opening chests or by progressing beyond Mossy Bronze II in the Hero Championships.

## Lore

### Main

Do not fabricate facts or create false information. Your task is to enhance the coherence and clarity of the text only.
Levi's Lore posted by JK Eff on Discord on April 27, 2021 | Written by Animatd

Explosions echo from the battlefield as a smoke screen rises and bullets fly through the air. A middle-aged man, the general, observes the chaos from above, accompanied by a massive woman. Her face contorts into an evil sneer as she states, “She's overconfident; she’s going to lose. Your daughter isn’t fit for this...” The general sighs and replies, “Bertha, it’s over. Let us end this.” Bertha laughs, her gaze fixed on the battlefield, “I thought she’d last longer, I...” The general interrupts her with a furious roar.

Shifting her eyes from the battlefield, Bertha murmured, “I thought she’d last longer, I...” The general interrupted her with a furious roar, “Enough! I have tolerated your jealousy long enough. She will succeed. As for us... we’re done.” Bertha's expression turned grim before becoming eerily calm as she gazed at him. “You will regret this,” she said, then turned and walked away.

Down below, the smoke clears to reveal two teams of three positioned on opposite sides of the battlefield. Bullet holes and cracks mar the stone pillars and barriers set up for training. One team, dressed in blue, is holding their ground. On the opposite side, the three members in green begin to separate, fanning out to the left, middle, and right. The member on the right arrives first, attempting to draw attention, but the blue team is prepared and shoots him before he can react. It turns out to be a trap; the green team was moving in unison, back-to-back as a cohesive unit.

The team is ready and quickly shoots their target before he can react. It’s a trap; they are moving back-to-back as a unit. With one enemy down, they form a triangle, with two members in front and one in the back, and advance forward. When another green enemy charges at them head-on, the two in front duck, while the blue member in the back takes aim and fires, hitting the green squarely between the eyes. “Levi, come out and play,” taunts the blue in the back. The team then falls into a single file and retreats to a stone wall, covering all angles. A shape can be seen lurking in the shadows.

The team forms a single file as they retreat backwards to a stone wall, ensuring they cover all angles. A shape appears on the right, prompting all team members in blue to aim in that direction. When the shape shifts to the left, their weapons quickly follow suit.

The blue soldier in the middle begins to sweat, while the one in the back gulps nervously. Silence hangs in the air. A bullet hole in the wall behind them reveals the green soldier, who is setting her sights through a scope. "Too easy," she mutters before pulling the trigger. Bullets soar through the hole in the stone, ripping through the three blue soldiers lined up in her sights. As they go down, a flare shoots up and transforms into the word “Congratulations.” The green soldier removes her mask to reveal Levi, a vibrant smile spreading across her face. The blue soldiers approach and jeer, “Good game, huh?”

The girl in green removes her mask to reveal Levi, who has a vibrant smile on her face. The group in blue approaches and jeers, “Good game, huh Lev? We thought we had you.” “Not a chance, twinkle toes,” Levi retorts with a grin. She looks up at the general, who smiles with pride and gives a nod of approval.

Later that week, during the graduation ceremony, eleven soldiers stood in a semi-circle facing the general, who held a case containing twelve vials. The general began by congratulating everyone on their achievements before explaining the next step in their extensive training. They were known as the famed and secret Night Owls—elite super soldiers, assassins, and spies—already at the pinnacle of their skills. Each vial contained a serum of nanites that would merge with their bodies, transforming them into the...

Already at the top of their game, each vial holds a serum of nanites that will merge with their bodies, turning them into the ultimate champions. Suddenly, a roll of thunder booms, and a flash of lightning illuminates the skies outside, revealing a shadow on a hill near the complex. Another flash shows Bertha, armed with her machine gun, accompanied by scores of figures in black. “I found someone better!” she shouts as her machine gun revs up, and... BLAM BLAM BLAM BLAM BLAM!

Bertha unloads explosive rounds on the complex, and as the mini explosions rip through the foundation, screams of terror rise above the din. Personnel who are not killed instantly are crushed by falling debris while attempting to escape the building. It is a massacre. Bertha remains emotionless as she expends thousands of explosive rounds into the structure. The building is nearly razed to the ground, and thick smoke envelops the area, obscuring the pile of bodies where the soldiers once stood. Suddenly, there is movement, and a hand emerges from the rubble.

The smoke is thick, covering the pile of bodies where the soldiers once stood. Suddenly, there is movement, and a hand emerges from beneath the heap. As Levi struggles to free herself, memories flood back to the moment explosive rounds tore through the wall, shattered the windows, and sent glass flying at unimaginable speeds.

As glass shattered, a long shard flew straight into Levi’s face. Her attempt to dodge was not fast enough to prevent the shard from tearing into her eye, sending her tumbling to the ground with blood gushing from the wound. “Protect Levi, everyone! NOW!” the general shouted, reacting immediately. The remaining soldiers rushed to her side, forming a protective barrier. As they piled around her, bullets began to tear through their bodies. The general fell dead beside them, dropping the case containing the nanites.

Wincing from the pain in her injured eye, Levi pushes herself up to see her friends and comrades, all dead. She spots her father’s body and stumbles over before collapsing to her knees. As she begins to weep, the sound of approaching footsteps jolts her back to reality. Quickly composing herself, she hides behind some debris. As the footsteps grow closer, she glances at her father one last time and notices the case nearby. If she could get to it, she might be able to heal and survive. Gritting her teeth, Levi makes a run for the case. She counts her steps, steeling herself for the challenge ahead.

Levi knew that if she could reach the case, she would have a chance to heal and survive. Gritting her teeth, she sprinted toward it. As she counted down the steps to her goal, the pain intensified, causing her to stumble. Determined, she pushed through the agony: 25 steps, then 15. Just then, Bertha emerged from the clearing smoke, also aiming for the case. Setting up her machine gun, Bertha prepared to fire just as Levi slid in, grabbed the case, and turned to make her escape. A bullet from Bertha’s machine gun clipped Levi’s heel as she sprinted for cover, forcing her to stop.

Levi grabs the case and turns to run, but Bertha’s machine gun fire clips her heel as she dashes for cover. She only stops when she reaches the safety of a wall and opens the case, but before she can grab a vial, bullets tear through the wall, hitting the case and sending all the vials flying. As Levi attempts to jump and catch one, the new pain in her heel delays her, and the vials begin to crash to the ground. Shaking off the pain, she dives and manages to catch the last vial just before it hits the ground. She scrambles to her feet.

She begins to crash to the ground. Shaking off the pain, she dives, catching the last object before it hits the ground. Scrambling to her feet, she takes off running just as bullets rip through the spot where she had been moments before. However, she doesn’t get far before she trips and falls, the path of fire following just inches behind her. Suddenly, the machine gun chokes on the hiss of steam and stops. “Reloading!” yells Bertha, and Levi looks at her in astonishment through a bullet hole in the stone. Then, she clenches her teeth and stabs.

Levi looks at her with astonishment through a bullet hole in the stone. She clenches her teeth and injects the serum into her leg. As the serum enters her bloodstream, her wounds begin to heal, and she starts to feel better.

Something feels off. The nanites are accumulating in her right eye after repairing her body wounds. She realizes they are constructing an eye for her. The pain subsides, her vision begins to return, and she can see far more clearly—right through the wall. “Cool,” she chuckles. Suddenly, the machine gun behind the wall starts up again. Levi perks up and vanishes into the storm with incredible speed.

Bertha leads three teams in the foremost squad. Moving through the rubble of the building, she pulls out a radar, scans the surrounding area, and notices the running red prints in the top right corner of the screen. She stops and says, “She’s here.” A shape darts to the right, prompting the entire team to adjust their aim in that direction. The shape then dashes to the left, and all scopes follow its movement. “So predictable,” Levi comments as the figure emerges from the shadows behind one of the soldiers in the back. His scream echoes in the air.

“So predictable,” says Levi as she steps out of the shadows behind one of the soldiers in the back. His scream echoes in the distance, causing the company to grow nervous. As the soldiers glance around, a bolt of lightning strikes, and thunder rumbles in the raging storm. Suddenly, two members of the company near the fallen soldier drop dead. 

“I didn’t sign up for this! This was supposed to be easy!” a soldier yells before abandoning his weapon and fleeing. “Pew pew…” can be heard as he is shot in both knees.

“Be easy!” a soldier screams before dropping his weapon and running away. “Pew pew…” As he flees, he is shot in both knees and collapses to the ground in agony. The remaining soldiers gather around Bertha, covering all directions. “Retreat, this is her playground,” Bertha says wearily. As they withdraw, Levi stands over one of the soldiers she has killed. She grabs the soldier's gun, removes the scope, discards the gun, and adds the scope to her own. Then, she follows the remaining soldiers.

She grabs the gun of the soldier she just killed, removes the scope, and discards the weapon itself, keeping only the scope to attach to her own. She then follows the remaining soldiers and the traitor, Bertha.

As the sun rises, its warmth envelops Levi, who stands with one foot on Bertha’s machine gun, gazing at Bertha’s badge of medals lying on the ground. Levi looks back at the horizon and lets out a sigh. Taking a moment, she tears off a piece of her sleeve and wraps it around her head, obscuring her right eye and deactivating her enhanced vision.

The Silver Surfer is a fictional character appearing in comic books published by Marvel Comics. He made his first appearance in "Fantastic Four" #48 in March 1966. Created by writer Stan Lee and artist Jack Kirby, the character is known for his cosmic powers and his role as a herald of Galactus, a cosmic entity that devours planets. The Silver Surfer, originally named Norrin Radd, hails from the planet Zenn-La. He sacrifices his freedom to save his homeworld from Galactus by agreeing to serve as his messenger.

Throughout his adventures, the Silver Surfer explores the universe, grappling with his responsibilities and the moral dilemmas that arise from his powers. He often encounters various heroes and villains, leading to complex relationships and conflicts. The character has been featured in numerous comic series, animated shows, and films, making him a significant part of the Marvel Universe. His storylines often explore themes of sacrifice, redemption, and the search for identity.

# Regular Shoulder Pad

The Regular Shoulder Pad is an important item in the game, enhancing the player's durability. It provides vital protection during combat, allowing for greater survivability against enemy attacks. Upgrading the shoulder pad can further improve its defensive capabilities. Players are encouraged to utilize this item strategically to gain an advantage in gameplay.
The Regular Shoulder Pad is a body-type gear that was introduced in update 3.3.

The Regular Shoulder Pad is a body-type gear that was introduced in update 3.3. 

This is what the Regular Shoulder Pad looks like in the Gear menu.

This is what the **Regular Shoulder Pad** looks like in the Gear menu.

It is not part of a set and can be used by all heroes.

## Effects

The Regular Shoulder Pad adds X% damage to armor. It increases the damage inflicted on armor by a certain percentage. 

The specific effect varies based on its tier; for example, if it is of epic tier, it will have an epic effect.

| **Modifier Table** |
| --- |
| **Common Effect:** +2% to weapon damage against enemy armor |
| **Rare Effect:** +4% to weapon damage against enemy armor |
| **Epic Effect:** +6% to weapon damage against enemy armor |
| **Legendary Effect:** +7% to weapon damage against enemy armor |
| **Mythic Effect:** +8% to weapon damage against enemy armor |
| **Supreme Effect:** +9% to weapon damage against enemy armor |
| **Ultimate Effect:** +10% to weapon damage against enemy armor |

| **Effect**             | **Weapon Damage Boost Against Enemy Armor** |
|------------------------|---------------------------------------------|
| **Ultimate Effect**    | +10%                                       |
| **Celestial Effect**   | +11%                                       |
| **Stellar Effect**     | +12%                                       |
| **Immortal Effect**    | +13%                                       |
| **Divine Effect**      | +14%                                       |

### Hero Information

### Snipers
These heroes possess low health and armor but are notorious for their deadly range, damage, and accuracy.

- Blot
- Slayer

Blot

Slayer

Mirage

Firefly

Lynx (Bow Subclass)

### Scouts - These heroes are small, fast, and capable of delivering powerful burst shots. They can navigate through tiny spaces on the map and move quickly, though they have very little health and armor.

### Tanks  
Big, slow, and heavy, these beefy heroes possess a large amount of health and armor, making them perfectly suited for absorbing damage in battle. 

- Raven  
- Freddie  
- Angel  
- Ghost  
- Bastion

### Troopers 

These heroes are generally well-rounded for various situations, making them particularly suitable for beginners.

- Bastion
- Dragoon
- Bertha
- Smog
- Leviathan
- Doc

### Ambushers

Armed with powerful short-ranged shotguns, these heroes are notoriously dangerous at close quarters. 

- Doc
- Levi
- Stalker
- Satoshi
- Arnie
- Sparkle

Arnie, Sparkle, Cyclops, and Hurricane are featured characters in this wiki.

# Chests

- History

Please do not fabricate facts or make assumptions. Your task is to enhance the coherence and clarity of the text only.
Chests are the primary way to acquire new heroes.

![Sh110.png](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/bullet-echo/images/4/47/Sh110.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/185?cb=20241128162908)  
![Sh111.png](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/bullet-echo/images/2/2e/Sh111.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/110?cb=20241128162908)

![Sh112.png](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/bullet-echo/images/8/88/Sh112.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/185?cb=20241128162909)

![Sh113.png](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/bullet-echo/images/e/e1/Sh113.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/111?cb=20241128162909)

![Sh114](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/bullet-echo/images/a/a0/Sh114.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/185?cb=20241128162909)  
![Sh115](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/bullet-echo/images/8/87/Sh115.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/109?cb=20241128162909)

In the game, there are three types of win chests, known as battle chests, and fifteen kill chests, referred to as skull chests. These chests can contain a new hero.

Additionally, there are two types of skin chests available. One costs 18 style tickets and offers a rare random skin, while the other costs 55 style tickets and provides either an epic or legendary random skin (though it does not guarantee all options).

These cookies help enhance your social media experience and allow for better interaction with our services. If you decline these cookies, you may encounter limitations in using social media features.

#### Social Media Cookies

Social Media Cookies are set by various social media services that we have integrated into our site to allow you to share our content with friends and networks. These cookies can track your browser activity across different websites and create a profile of your interests. # Tactical Knee Pads

Tactical Knee Pads are an essential piece of gear designed to provide protection and comfort during intense activities. They help to absorb impact and reduce the risk of injury to the knees. Ideal for various tactical situations, these pads offer durability and flexibility, ensuring that users can move freely while remaining safeguarded.

Tactical knee pads are a specialized piece of equipment designed to provide protection and support during various activities. They are often used in military and tactical scenarios as well as in sports or other physically demanding situations. The primary purpose of these knee pads is to absorb impact, reduce the risk of injury, and enhance the durability of the user’s gear. 

The design of tactical knee pads typically includes features such as adjustable straps for a secure fit, reinforced materials for added protection, and a lightweight construction to ensure mobility. By incorporating these elements, tactical knee pads offer both safety and comfort, allowing users to focus on their tasks without worrying about potential knee injuries.

## Lore

Skullfire Firefly

Firefly's lore was shared by JK Eff on Discord on September 22, 2020, and written by Илюшечкин.

### Main

Don't fabricate facts or hallucinate. Your job is to enhance the coherence of the text and make it easier to understand, nothing more.

A charismatic leader and master burglar, Jacob "Firefly" Jagovany, is surrounded by numerous rumors and legends that reflect his standout personality. However, one fact remains: wherever his elusive orange wagon appears, trouble is sure to follow. Finding no place in a society dominated by corporations, Jacob decided to reshape it according to his vision, beginning by declaring war on its most influential figures.

Jacob soon gathered a gang of like-minded rebels, but he understood that the forces in this battle would be unequal. To strike at the heart of the local fat cats, he decided to target their bank vaults. The gang employed various methods to achieve their goal, ranging from violent robberies and document forgeries to disguising themselves as law enforcement or hacking the bank’s security systems. Once inside the vault, Jacob and his team would not take money or valuables; instead, they set them ablaze on the spot. Ordinary robbery would have been too simple.

Jacob and his team refused to accept money or valuables; instead, they burned them on the spot. Committing an ordinary robbery would have meant conforming to the existing rules of the system, but Jacob aimed to establish his own rules, which required him to exit that system entirely. After all, he was neither Al Capone, looking to build a money-laundering empire, nor Robin Hood, who redistributed wealth to the poor.

No one knows what led Jacob to join the P.Y.R.O. Perhaps when the powers that be, controlling local police and officials, send their best men after you, it's wise to throw them off your trail and seek out equally influential benefactors. Maybe Jacob simply decided to support P.Y.R.O. and transform it into something larger than a fragmented gang of anarchists. Regardless, by joining the faction, he raised the stakes. The news of his first major heist—a raid on a strategic bunker filled with Cold War-era weapons—sent shockwaves through the community.

The stakes were high, and the news of Jacob's first major heist—a raid on a strategic bunker filled with Cold War-era weapons—shook the area for a long time. The well-guarded storage facility was deemed too secure for a gang of robbers; however, it ultimately fell to a small army. This time, Jacob and his accomplices chose not to destroy the spoils but to steal them for future operations. This acquisition solved P.Y.R.O's issues with weapons and ammunition for years to come.

## Lore

### Main

Avoid fabricating details or imagining information. Your task is to enhance the coherence and clarity of the text only.
A beautiful woman has brought Hurricane to the Arenas, and he doesn’t even know her name.

A beautiful woman has brought Hurricane to the Arenas, and he didn't even know her name.

In his former life, you wouldn't have glanced twice at Harold Kane: just another office worker in a slightly crumpled suit, heading to yet another day in a tiny cubicle. He had an unimaginative job, a sad old dog in a small apartment, and no close family or friends. But that was only the surface; inside him burned a great passion.

For many years, Kane was an avid gamer who devoted all his free hours to a single tactical shooter game. To say he was skilled at it would be an understatement; he was among the best players. However, he was also one of the most enigmatic figures in the gaming community. While the real-life identity of the player known as Hurricane was not a secret to those willing to invest time and money to uncover it, Kane consistently refused all offers, contracts, and friendships.

Let’s revisit that day: Harold was in the office, and since it was quiet, he found himself playing. Although he had a strict rule against playing at work, he usually adhered to it. However, when the new maps were unveiled in the morning, he couldn't call in sick, so he decided to take a quick peek at them. Just a glance turned into a test run. Those maps were impressive; he realized he needed to explore them further. All the while, he remained oblivious to everything happening around him.

A new intern, a pretty girl, started in the office. The head of the department, a sadistic bully who rarely visited the office floor of his subordinates, took an interest in her after encountering her in the elevator. However, the intern was unimpressed by his looks, position, or offers, which left him in a foul mood. By chance, he passed by Kane’s cubicle and noticed his screen.

If Kane had just been fired, we wouldn't have a story to tell. Instead, he was taken to an unknown location, handed an old shotgun, and left alone. The following night turned into a nightmare, but somehow he survived. He had to endure this ordeal repeatedly. His boss decided that if Kane wanted to play, he could continue to do so—so he sold Kane out to become one of the lab rats in weapon testing. Luckily, the corporation was involved in many different areas. It was Sterling who identified Kane, who was by then badly mauled. Some things were...

Sterling was the one who noticed and recognized Kane, who was badly injured at the time. Some of his wounds were patched up, while others were replaced with high-tech gear. All of this was done so he could fight again and again, without hesitation. But Hurricane doesn’t really mind.

This is what the Reflex Implant looks like in the Gear menu.

The Reflex Implant is a body-type gear introduced in update 3.3. It is not part of a set and can be used by all heroes.

This gear is not part of a set and can be used by any hero.

It resembles a blue spine with copper wires extending from the top and bottom holes.

## Effects

It reduces the hero's primary weapon spread by a certain percentage, making the overall firing spread smaller. This allows bullets to travel with greater accuracy.
It reduces your hero's overall firing spread, allowing bullets to travel with greater accuracy. The effect varies based on the item's tier; for example, an epic tier item will provide an epic effect.

| Modifier Table |
| --- |
| **Common Effect:** - Reduces hero's weapon recoil by 5% |
| **Rare Effect:** - Reduces hero's weapon recoil by 10% |
| **Epic Effect:** - Reduces hero's weapon recoil by 15% |
| **Legendary Effect:** - Reduces hero's weapon recoil by 20% |
| **Mythic Effect:** - Reduces hero's weapon recoil by 25% |
| **Supreme Effect:** - Reduces hero's weapon recoil by 30% |
| **Ultimate Effect:** - Reduces hero's weapon recoil by 35% |
| **Celestial Effect:** - Reduces hero's weapon recoil by 36% |

## Gears and Upgrades

Raven has access to the exclusive Skeleton gear set, which is designed for Scout Heroes, as well as his own personal quarantine gear set.

Raven can utilize the following upgrades:

- Foregrip
- Explosive rounds
- Enhanced ammunition
- Visor

Raven has access to several upgrades:

- Foregrip
- Explosive rounds
- Enhanced ammunition
- Visor

## Tips

- If you scan and either don't find anyone or see an enemy that cannot or will not attack, cancel your scan. This action will allow your scan to recharge faster while still revealing the enemy's position.

Learn Raven's spread pattern. Once you can control your spread effectively, spread reduction gears become unnecessary, and you can run at full speed without compromising your chances of getting a kill.

Take advantage of your increased range after landing a hit. Move towards the enemy, hit them, and then "kite" backwards to create some distance while continuing to fire shots.

Use disarm to its fullest potential; Raven can often eliminate multiple opponents and even an entire team with just his disarm ability, although his magazine capacity may pose a challenge.

# All Raven Skins

## Lore

### Main

Raven's Lore was posted by JK Eff on Bullet Echo's Facebook Page on August 22, 2020, and written by ZeptoLabs.

Story time! This one’s called 'RAVEN and the Non-vision Vision.'

One major thing that few people guessed (and we don’t blame you) is that Raven is actually blind. “What? How? Doesn’t he rule Vision?” Yes, he does, but very few in the Arenas are aware of his biggest secret:

Raven was born blind. His mother knew that this was not the only deficiency her son had, but he was too small for her to uncover his hidden talents before she died. Left on his own, he faced the challenges of the world. His sunny homeland protected him from freezing to death while he slept on the streets, but he had to be quick on his feet and alert at all times to find food each day. There were kind strangers willing to shelter him and even adopt the boy, but the sight of his empty, cold, all-black eyes often left them hesitant.

Kind strangers were always ready to shelter and even adopt the boy, despite the shuddering discomfort caused by the sight of his empty, cold, all-black eyes. However, each time the story would end the same way: one day, Raven would pause in his actions, as if listening to a distant sound, and then inform his benefactor of a death in the family or a great tragedy that had just occurred miles away. For the superstitious people of his country, this was simply too much, especially since the news always turned out to be true.

For the superstitious people of his country, this was simply too much, especially since the news turned out to be true. It was at this moment that he earned the name Raven—reflecting his dark eyes, his uncanny premonitions, and his role in bringing bad news.

Raven himself would not admit that he sold his soul for a special sight. However, the truth is that he can perceive certain things more clearly than most sharp-eyed individuals. When you feel a presence, it is Raven sensing your impending death.

Raven is the youngest member of the Arenas and is still just a teenager.

He can speak, but he rarely does. He has learned the hard way that some of his words can upset others, leading him to grow increasingly distrustful of people.
The mask was suggested by a fighter from another faction. Initially, the smell of blood was too distracting for Raven. However, he grew to love the mask so much that he never takes it off now.

Raven has no military experience, which may have heightened his instinct to flee whenever others sniffed out the rumors about the strange boy. However, he couldn't escape—or perhaps chose not to escape—the attention of Mr. Sterling and his agents. Participating in the Arenas provided him with a sense of worth, belonging, and direction in life. Who knows? Over time, this fighter might become even more formidable! 

Now, who’s next?

Now, who’s next?

# Troopers

History

Purge

Talk (0)

Do not invent facts or create false information. Your role is to enhance the coherence of the text and make it easier to understand.

Troopers are versatile units, proficient in various aspects of combat. They possess medium movement speed, along with medium to high damage output and a medium to high fire rate. Troopers are capable of executing flanking maneuvers, but they can also hold their ground on the frontlines. However, due to their large size, they are unable to pass through narrow gaps.

As of March 25, 2023, there are five Troopers available.

List of Troopers:

As of March 25, 2023, there are five Troopers available. 

The list of Troopers includes:

- Doc
- Levi
- Satoshi
- Stalker
- Tess
- Vi

The Protective Glasses is a piece of headgear that was introduced in update 3.3. This gear is not part of a set and can be used independently.

The Protective Glasses is a headgear item that was introduced in update 3.3. This gear is not part of any set and can be used by all heroes. 

It appears as safety goggles featuring a bleak brown color and a bridge that allows them to rest comfortably on the nose.

## Effects

When equipped, the Protective Glasses enhance the hero's vision range.

When equipped, this item affects the hero's vision range, which is the distance a hero can see. The effect varies based on the item's tier; for example, if it is epic gear, it will have an epic effect.

# Bullet Echo India

Bullet Echo India is a distinct game developed by Krafton Inc. for Android and iOS devices.

This is a separate game from Krafton Inc. for Android and iOS devices, specifically redesigned for the Indian market. It features PUBG character skins, including Stalker and Mirage, as well as Slayer skins that are not available in the global version of Bullet Echo.
Bullet Echo India is available on both iOS and Android platforms. You can download the app from the Apple App Store or the Google Play Store.

# Factions/Skytech Megacorp

Skytech Megacorp is one of the prominent factions within the game. The faction is known for its advanced technology and innovation, which sets it apart from others. Players often engage with Skytech Megacorp to benefit from its cutting-edge developments and unique strategies. It’s essential to familiarize yourself with this faction to understand its role and influence in the game's dynamics.

# Factions/Skytech Megacorp

Factions

Skytech Megacorp is a significant player in the landscape of various factions. It specializes in advanced technology and innovation, making it a formidable force in its sector. The corporation is known for its cutting-edge research and development, which drives its competitive edge. With a focus on expansion and dominance, Skytech Megacorp continues to shape the future of technology and influence the dynamics among the factions. Its objectives align closely with securing a powerful position in the market while navigating the complexities of factional relationships.

- History
- Purge
- Talk (0)
Skytech Megacorp

**Skytech Megacorp** is renowned not for its military operations, but for its monopoly over high-end technology and its expertise in cybernetics and artificial intelligence. They were the first to successfully implement Echo technology, a breakthrough that further solidified their dominance in the industry.

They possess high-tech gadgets and advanced weaponry. The corporation is overseen by a mysterious board of directors, whose stakeholders remain unknown. According to credible rumors, control of the corporation has been predominantly exercised by artificial intelligence.

Skytech agents have the highest armor and defense stats among all factions and heroes. Their defensive abilities are exceptional for area control. However, be cautious, as P.Y.R.O. soldiers serve as formidable counters to Skytech Megacorp agents.

# Trophy Road

# Trophy Road

When you win a match, you earn a trophy. Accumulating these trophies allows you to progress along Trophy Road and unlock various rewards.

When you win a match, you earn trophies that allow you to progress along Trophy Road and unlock various rewards.

The trophy system begins at 0 and goes up to 10,000 trophies. 

Initially, from 0 to 2400 trophies, the rewards are mixed and quite useful. 

After reaching 2400 trophies, you will receive a reward for every 100 trophies earned, such as at 2500, 2600, and so on, all the way up to 10,000 trophies.

After reaching 2400 trophies, you will receive a reward for every additional 100 trophies, such as at 2500, 2600, and so on, up to 10,000 trophies.

Upon reaching 10,000 trophies, it is essential to have at least one Divine hero to start earning Bravery Road points. If you do not possess a Divine hero at this level, you will not earn any trophies. Therefore, aim to enhance at least one character to Divine status to begin accumulating Bravery Points.

### General

Don't make up facts or hallucinate. Your job is to enhance the text's coherence and make it easier to understand.

Bullet Echo is a free-to-play, top-down, fast-paced action twin-stick shooter mobile game developed and published by Zeptolab. It is available on both the Google Play Store and the Apple App Store. The game's development began in early 2018, and it underwent beta testing in Russia and a few selected countries. In the second quarter of 2020, the game was launched to a wider audience.

The project began in early 2018 and underwent beta testing in Russia and a few selected countries. By the second quarter of 2020, the game was released globally. Since then, it has gained over 2 million downloads on both platforms.

### Lore

Do not invent facts or create false information. Your role is to enhance the coherence of the text and make it easier to understand.

The game is set in a distant future characterized by breakthroughs in cybernetics, computing, and bioengineering technologies. In this world, governments have become obsolete, and organized factions have risen to power, vying for global dominance. This shift has opened up new possibilities for individuals, including high-tech implants, genome modification, energy shields, as well as abilities such as x-ray vision, ultra-short spatial jumps, and short-term invisibility. Players collaborate with these factions by piloting advanced technologies.

Ultra-short spatial jumps, short-term invisibility, and other unique abilities enhance the gameplay experience. Players collaborate with various factions by piloting the Echo, which are high-tech clones of each faction's best fighters.

"You share the winner's glory with organizations, and in return, they provide you with their supreme killing machines." 

\- Mr. Sterling

- _Mr. Sterling_

### Game Description on Google Play

Lead your team to victory in this unique PvP tactical team shooter! Choose from a wide array of heroes, each with distinct play styles and abilities.

Unite with friends, devise a strategy, and strive to be the last team standing when the battle concludes!

From the creators of C.A.T.S.: Crash Arena Turbo Stars, King of Thieves, and Cut the Rope.

- UNIQUE TACTICAL STEALTH ACTION: Your visibility is limited to the beam of a flashlight, but you can hear the footsteps and gunshots of your enemies.

- DESIGNED FOR TEAM PLAY: Jump into online games with friends immediately! Your hero's level is adjusted to match the highest level in your party.

- MULTIPLE GAME MODES: Enjoy various gameplay options, including Team vs. Team, Solo, and Battle Royale mode, where five small teams compete on a single map.

- UNLOCK AND UPGRADE NEW HEROES: Each hero possesses a unique set of abilities. Level up to enhance your hero's power and unlock exciting new perks.

- STAY ON TOP: Compete in championships, complete missions, and earn valuable resources.

- BE ON TOP: Participate in championships, complete missions, and earn valuable resources.

- GET REWARDS: Compete to unlock new heroes, each with unique weapons, perks, maps, and game modes!

Note: Here is a quick description or in-game hero Card Info.

Cyclops is an ambusher hero belonging to the Force and Arms faction. His playstyle differs from that of other ambushers; unlike them, Cyclops can engage enemies at range with his shotgun, thanks to his passive ability. Additionally, his scan ability aids both him and his teammates in gathering intelligence. He is much more effective when played in teams.

This hero can be unlocked by advancing past Mossy Bronze III in the Hero Championships.
This hero can be unlocked by progressing beyond Mossy Bronze III in the Hero Championships.

## Gears and Upgrades

Cyclops has access to the exclusive White Marble gear set designated for Ambusher Heroes, as well as his own unique gear set, the Cyclops Inferno gear set.

Available upgrades for Cyclops are:

Available upgrades for Cyclops are:

- Enhanced Magazine
- Explosive Rounds
- Armor Enhancer
- Visor

## Strengths and Weaknesses

**Notable Strengths**:

Unlike other common ambushers, Cyclops's shotgun has a greater range thanks to their Invader passive, which provides a 75% increase in aimed fire range. Additionally, the Siege Expert passive grants a 75% boost in aimed movement speed to both Cyclops and their allies. 

The Invader passive also allows Cyclops to halve the enemy's vision and firing range with a single shot, giving Cyclops a significant advantage in combat situations as long as they land the first shot.

His siege expert passive enables him to blind anyone within a 360-degree radius for 1.8 seconds after securing a kill or a downed enemy. This ability helps him effectively ambush grouped enemies. 

He also has decent damage, fire range, fire rate, and health.

**Notable weakness:**

Do not fabricate facts or create false information. Your role is to enhance the coherence of the text and make it easier to understand.

Cyclops will be notably weak without his upgrades and passive abilities, making him quite fragile in less competitive lobbies. Most of the heroes from the Skytech Megacorp faction are counters to Cyclops, and the same is true for many heroes from the Force and Arms faction.

- The Cyclops' ranged capabilities are limited because it must slow down its movement or stop completely to utilize them.
- The Invader passive's reduction of fire and vision range is nearly ineffective when the enemy is already very close.
- The benefit of the Cyclops' Siege Expert buff is diminished for its teammates because it is situational.

## Tips and Tricks

Here are some tips that may enhance your gameplay:

- Stay grounded in reality; avoid fabricating facts or hallucinating. Your focus should be on providing clear and coherent information.

If the Precision implant is upgraded sufficiently, combining it with Cyclops' Siege expert passive can maximize Cyclops' movement speed while aiming to match his movement speed without aiming. This allows for a consistent aiming experience similar to that of Mirage, making it easier to aim. However, rotating too quickly can still disrupt your aiming stability.

- Be cautious of armored enemies. One of the Cyclops' weaknesses is armor, as Cyclops cannot inflict full damage to an enemy's health when they are armored.
- Always equip armor before engaging in battle.
- Utilize the Scan ability to target enemies hiding in the grass. This ability reveals hidden enemies, allowing your firing cone to detect them even from outside the grass. This way, you and your allies can effectively shoot them.

- To cancel a scan, simply click it again after using it. This allows you to quickly prepare for another use. Canceling the scan does not stop its functionality; it will continue to operate normally until the timer runs out, although the timer bar will disappear.  
- If you are playing as part of a team, make sure to cover your teammates from different sides or flank the enemies.  
- Use cover to protect yourself from incoming attacks, but be cautious of heroes with high piercing abilities.

## Lore

Don't fabricate facts or indulge in imagination. Your task is to enhance the coherence of the text and make it easier to understand.
**"Another day... Another task... Another battle... Nature is just a long war for survival..."**

Corporal Calum McManus of the 77th Dublin Infantry Battalion was raised by a single father in the dense forests of Central Europe. Growing up, he learned to be resourceful and to make use of whatever nature provided. Crafting, tracking, and hunting became essential skills, and the young boy became intimately familiar with the kick of the buckshot from his father's shotgun. After his father passed away, Calum moved back to Ireland in an attempt to connect with his ancestral roots.

After his father's death, he returned to Ireland in an attempt to connect with his ancestral roots. However, with the country's woodlands nearly depleted, there were limited opportunities for a man with his abilities. Consequently, he enlisted in the military, where his quick thinking, resourcefulness, and marksmanship with firearms earned him the position of a close-quarters specialist. Armed with an automatic shotgun, he and his squad cleared numerous buildings and secured various sectors from terrorists and rebels throughout their operations.

With his shotgun in hand, he and his squad cleared dozens of buildings and numerous sectors of terrorists and rebels throughout their service. For a time, Calum believed he had found his place among his people. However, this perception changed when the Taoiseach of Ireland began approving various “Peacekeeping Missions” in foreign lands. Thousands of Irish soldiers lost their lives overseas, protecting corrupt governments indifferent to their well-being. It was no secret that the Taoiseach was influenced by the growing power of megacorporations.

It was widely known that the Taoiseach was under the influence of the growing megacorporations, undermining Irish power and stability in order to sell the country to the highest bidder. Soon, it would be Calum's turn to be thrown into the meat grinder.

He was deployed in a foreign jungle, among people who did not speak the same language. Caught in a bloody ambush, Calum nearly drowned in a river as he fled from the insurgents. Losing most of his supplies in the water, he decided to abandon the mission. His only goal now was to survive and make it back to their Forward Operating Base.

**"Civilization...? Power...? Normalcy...? Empty concepts created by cowards and weaklings so that the strong may die in their stead..."**

Other than the rebels, the tropical jungle was teeming with all sorts of parasites and predators. He spent his days on long walks, keeping his eyes and ears open while carefully navigating through the dense trees. Nights were filled with tense paranoia as he tried to catch a few minutes of fitful sleep, shielding himself from the rain. To blend into his surroundings, he had even fashioned a makeshift Ghillie Suit from nearby plants. Eventually, his food supplies began to dwindle, and he had little luck finding animals to hunt. Calum felt fortunate when he spotted...

Eventually, his food supplies ran low, and he was having little success in finding animals to hunt. Calum felt a surge of hope when he spotted smoke rising from a nearby village. However, that hope quickly faded when he noticed the armed men patrolling the area, realizing that the rebels controlled the village. Despite this, he was determined not to give up after having come so far.
"... Only out here, in the roar of battle, does nature speak clearly..."

Under the cover of night, he crept in. He killed one guard with his knife and grabbed an isolated man, holding him at gunpoint. "Food! Where is the food?!" he demanded. The terrified man seemed confused until Calum made exaggerated eating gestures. When the man pointed towards a specific house, Calum knocked him out with the butt of his shotgun and quietly moved on. 

Once inside, he quickly stuffed all the water and food items he could carry into his repaired backpack. That’s when he noticed a little girl staring at him. Their eyes met, and they looked at each other, frozen in the moment.
As he gathered water and food items to carry in his repaired backpack, he noticed a little girl staring at him. They exchanged a moment of disbelief, and then the child started screaming.

Calum dropped the food in his hands and quickly ran to the girl, wrapping her in his arms. He knew they had heard her, and he had to leave immediately. This girl was his best chance for survival. Holding her tightly, he dragged her outside.

**"I had to survive... and if the girl was smart... she would survive too..."**

Men and women, some armed, rushed out of their huts and saw a man covered in leaves with wild eyes, holding a child at gunpoint with a dirty shotgun. "STAY BACK!" Calum shouted. If they didn’t understand, he shouted louder, shaking the girl and his gun. Whenever someone tried to approach, he would yell at them, and if anyone pointed a weapon at him, he pressed the shotgun hard against the girl's head, making her cry out. He repeated this throughout the tense standoff.

As he walked out of the village, he pressed the shotgun tightly against the girl's head, causing her to cry out in fear. He maintained this threat until he had distanced himself from the villagers. Once he felt he was far enough away, he shoved the girl aside and disappeared into the shadows of the jungle.

In the safety of darkness, he examined the supplies he had managed to steal. Although he was not satisfied with the quantity, he hoped it would be enough to get him home. Just then, he heard the sound of plane engines.

Looking up, he saw the streaks of jet fighters cutting through the starry sky. He had only a moment to ponder their mission when he heard the familiar roar of screaming missiles. The ground trembled as the night erupted into an orange inferno, with missiles crashing into the trees. Calum watched in horror as the jungle and the village he had just left were consumed by flames, just seconds before he turned and ran for his life.

At first, the screaming sounded distant, but soon it erupted from his own mouth as fire and smoke enveloped him. His muscles burned as fiercely as his skin while he ran, but eventually, his legs gave out. He crawled as far as his arms would carry him. Smoke filled his lungs, and he felt the chemicals searing his skin and burning his eyes.

He would have fought death with his last breath, but it was not meant to be his final day.

He would have fought against death until his last breath, but it was not meant to be his final day.

**"My superiors believed it would be better if I were dead... These people promised not only life but also my eyes... I had no choice."**

Calum woke up blind, having been told that although his body had been saved, his lungs were damaged and he would never see again. He was found by an assault squad and treated until his superiors decided they couldn't afford to have a witness to the firebombing. A strange visitor then approached his hospital bed, claiming that his organization could make use of a man with his determination. He hinted that Calum would be listed as missing in action within the week. The man promised to grant him sight greater than he had ever known, but only if he swore an oath.
He would be listed as MIA within the week. The man informed him that if he swore an oath to obey the will of their "Great Leader," they would grant him greater sight than he had ever known.

Calum was acutely aware of what his government would do to him if he chose to stay. The men in power had killed for far less. He refused to become just another statistic in their body count. Determined to survive, he was resolute in his commitment to do whatever it took to be the last man standing.

In the night, he was whisked away on a discreet transport and placed on a plane to an unknown destination. He found himself lying in a new hospital bed, surrounded by strange voices that told him he would soon see everything as it truly was. The following days blurred into a haze of sedatives and pain as medical tools invaded his skull. Occasionally, the voices by his bedside would speak in languages foreign to him, chanting the same words, sometimes for hours on end. Calum lost track of how long he was kept there, until the bandages were finally removed.

Unknown to him, others were chanting the same words, sometimes for hours on end. Calum lost track of how long he had been kept there until the bandages from his face were removed. A solitary voice then instructed him to open his eye.
"My sight, my body, my life—none of it felt like it belonged to me anymore. To survive, I had to transform myself into a weapon: their weapon, his weapon..."

At first, seeing again was painfully bright, and he could not bear to keep his eyes open for long. However, through medicine and therapy, it became easier, and the headaches faded more quickly. Soon, his new eye began utilizing the strength of his old ones, allowing him to gain additional sight lines and transferring an odd yellow glow to his once-dead white eyes. They told him they had given him back his life and his sight. Calum knew that none of it belonged to him anymore, but surprisingly, he did not mind. These people had not only saved him from certain death.

Calum understood that none of it was his any longer, yet surprisingly, he did not mind. These people had not only rescued him from certain death but had also restored his vision and promised him a position of prominence among them. He felt that his loyalty was a fair exchange.

He was no longer Corporal Calum McManus, and he did not want anyone to recognize him as such. He concealed every aspect that hinted at his former life. Now, he was an ogre of the wilds, an Oni of the woods—a primal force that was neither good nor evil, but a reminder of the natural order. He had become a member of a pack of predators who simply adhered to the principle of survival of the fittest.

Force and Arms did not just recruit a soldier; they summoned a Cyclops.
Force and Arms did not merely recruit a soldier; they summoned a Cyclops.

This is the Commander's Beret in the Gear Menu.

The Commander's Beret is a type of headgear that was introduced in update 3.3. It is not part of any set and can be equipped by all heroes.

This gear is not part of a set and can be used by all heroes. 

It appears as a blue, police-like beret with a badge in the front. 

## Effects

When equipped, it influences the volume of the hero's footsteps.

When equipped, this item affects the volume of the hero's footsteps. 

As you walk, the noise made by your footsteps varies based on your speed; the slower you move, the quieter your footsteps become, allowing you to remain undetected by enemies.

The effects are also influenced by the item's tier. For example, an epic tier item will provide an epic effect.

## Abilities

### Burrow

Molly possesses the ability to burrow. This skill allows her to navigate through the ground effectively, making it easier for her to evade enemies or ambush them from below. Her burrowing capability enhances her stealth and mobility, providing her with a tactical advantage in various situations.

Molly can burrow underground and remain there for 5 seconds. While she is underground, she cannot see enemies but continuously scans a radius of 200 units around her to reveal any enemies above.

When the ability ends, Molly jumps back to the surface, dealing damage and disarming all nearby enemies for a few seconds.

If Molly is within the radius of an explosion while underground, she will be forced to the surface without applying the disarm effect on surrounding enemies.

## Effects

The upgrade pick-up time is reduced by X%. 

The effect varies depending on the tier of the upgrade. 

For example, if the upgrade is classified as epic, it will have an epic effect.

| Modifier Table |
| --- |
| **Common Effect:** - Reduces pickup time for upgrades by 5% |
| **Rare Effect:** - Reduces pickup time for upgrades by 10% |
| **Epic Effect:** - Reduces pickup time for upgrades by 15% |
| **Legendary Effect:** - Reduces pickup time for upgrades by 20% |
| **Mythic Effect:** - Reduces pickup time for upgrades by 25% |
| **Supreme Effect:** - Reduces pickup time for upgrades by 30% |
| **Ultimate Effect:** - Reduces pickup time for upgrades by 35% |
| **Celestial Effect:** - Reduces pickup time for upgrades by 36% |

| **Effect Name**         | **Pickup Time Reduction**  |
|-------------------------|----------------------------|
| **Ultimate Effect**     | -35%                       |
| **Celestial Effect**    | -36%                       |
| **Stellar Effect**      | -37%                       |
| **Immortal Effect**     | -38%                       |
| **Divine Effect**       | -39%                       |

# Ambushers

- History
- Purge
- Talk (0)

Please refrain from fabricating facts or experiencing hallucinations. Your task is to enhance the coherence of the text and improve its clarity.

Enforcers are fast units that excel at flanking maneuvers. They typically possess medium to high health, quick movement speed, and strong short-range damage capabilities. However, they tend to struggle against high armor heroes, such as SkyTech, due to their naturally low armor penetration and damage against armored targets. Equipped with shotguns, Ambushers can easily flank and dismantle opposing teams, though their large models hinder their ability to navigate narrow pathways.

List of Enforcers:

**List of Enforcers:**

- Arnie
- Sparkle
- Cyclops
- Hurricane
- Shenji
- Molly

# Healing Implant

- History
- Purge
- Talk

The Healing Implant is a device designed to enhance the healing process of its users. It is essential for those engaged in high-risk activities where injuries are common. The implant's primary function is to accelerate recovery by promoting cellular regeneration and tissue repair. Users often report significantly reduced downtime after sustaining injuries, making it a valuable asset in various combat scenarios.

![Healing Implant](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/bullet-echo/images/6/68/Healing_Implant.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/382?cb=20200922144110)

This is what the gear looks like in the Gear menu.

The Healing Implant is a Body Gear introduced in update 3.3. It is not part of a set and can be used by all heroes. The design resembles a goldish spinal cord.

This gear is not part of a set and can be used by all heroes. 

It resembles a goldish spinal cord.

## Effects

When equipped, it provides the hero with passive healing. For example, it functions similarly to Bastion's legendary tier armored gear, which gradually heals armor. 

Depending on its tier, it will have different effects.
Like Bastion's legendary-tier armor, which slowly heals over time, the effects vary based on the item's tier. For example, if the item is of epic quality, it will have an epic effect.

| Modifier Table |
| --- |
| **Common Effect:** +2 Health Per Second for the hero |
| **Rare Effect:** +5 Health Per Second for the hero |
| **Epic Effect:** +7 Health Per Second for the hero |
| **Legendary Effect:** +8 Health Per Second for the hero |
| **Mythic Effect:** +10 Health Per Second for the hero |
| **Supreme Effect:** +12 Health Per Second for the hero |
| **Ultimate Effect:** +15 Health Per Second for the hero |
| **Celestial Effect:** +16 Health Per Second for the hero |

| **Ultimate Effect:**   | +15 Health Per Second for the hero  |
| **Celestial Effect:**  | +16 Health Per Second for the hero  |
| **Stellar Effect:**    | +17 Health Per Second for the hero  |
| **Immortal Effect:**   | +18 Health Per Second for the hero  |
| **Divine Effect:**     | +19 Health Per Second for the hero  |
Editors Note: This gear has one of the most disorganized upgrade systems. It begins with 2 upgrades, then adds 3, followed by 2, then 1, and continues in this irregular pattern.

# Star Pass

# Star Pass

Star Pass is a Battle Pass system in Bullet Echo.

✪ The Star Pass is a Battle Pass system in Bullet Echo.

☆ Typically, a new hero is introduced with each pass, which requires real money to purchase.

⭐ The pass remains active for approximately 90 to 120 days, or about 3 to 4 months.

🌟 There are 3 episodes in a Star Pass, each lasting nearly one month (30 days). As you unlock each episode, more rewards become available.

✨ Free rewards are also provided, with tiers available for both the standard Star Pass and the Star Pass Plus, which feature separate rewards.

✨ Free rewards are also available. The rewards are divided into tiers, with separate categories for free and paid Star Pass versus Star Pass Plus.

🆕 The Star Pass was redesigned in the November 28, 2024 update. It now features both free tiers and paid tiers as distinct options.

All Previous Star Pass Characters:

1. Lynx (22 August 2022)  
2. Tess (25 November 2022)  
3. Shenji (3 March 2023)  
4. Alice (30 June 2023)  
5. Ramsay (6 October 2023)  
6. Vi (30 January 2024)

6. Vi (30 January 2024)  
7. Blizzard (8 May 2024)  
8. Molly (13 August 2024 - 27 November 2024)  
9. Twinkle (28 November 2024 - Current; it will last 98 days)

## Easter Eggs are hidden details meant to be discovered in Bullet Echo.

They include:

1. The Loading Screens section mentions a soundboard and an "Hacker" achievement, which involves clicking squares in a specific order: 3 - 2 - 1 - 4 - 7 - 8 - 9 - 8 - 7 - 4 - 1 - 2 - 3. For more details, refer to the Loading Screens section for an explanation.

2. The Blue Fire Zone achievement is awarded for obtaining three triangle visors and dying from blue fire damage. This achievement is only applicable to heroes compatible with visors.

2. Blue Fire Zone (achievement for obtaining three triangle visors and dying from blue fire damage) - only for visor-compatible heroes.  
3. In a train-themed map, die by getting hit by a train to earn the "I Like Trains" achievement.

## Rules and How to Play

This mode accommodates up to 4 players, who will all be on the same team. The objective is to survive against a horde of infected enemies and reach stage 7, where you can evacuate via a train. The difficulty level will be determined by the number of players in the lobby.

When you are downed, there will be no timer. Your teammate can either revive you immediately or wait until the end of the wave for an instant revival. 

Ammunition, upgrades, and armor will be scattered throughout the map. Infected enemies will also drop loot; however, all loot dropped by the infected will be burned and destroyed at the start of the new stage.

Your hero will spawn without a main ability, but you can pick up abilities as loot. The available abilities include: Grenade, Grenade Launcher/Rocket, Fire Hunter, Force Field, Turret, Freeze Mines, Ball Lightning, Scan, and Blink. Any hero can collect these abilities. Once you are downed, your equipped ability will be lost.

In some stages, players will receive orders to complete specific tasks or objectives. There will be consequences for failing to complete these tasks.

## Stage Objectives/Tasks

Ensure that you clearly understand the objectives and tasks for this stage. Focus on the following key points: 

1. Define the primary goals specific to this stage.
2. Outline the necessary tasks that need to be completed to meet these goals.
3. Identify any resources or support required to accomplish these tasks.
4. Set a timeline for each task to ensure timely progress. 

By maintaining clarity and organization, you will be better equipped to succeed in this stage.

In stages 2, 4, and 6, players will be assigned one of four different objectives or tasks to complete. They must finish each objective within 2 minutes and 30 seconds. If time runs out and players fail to complete the objective, the infected will become extremely fast, making it nearly impossible to win the stage. The four objectives include:

#### Escorting a Survivor:

When escorting a survivor, your primary objective is to protect them while guiding them to safety. Stay vigilant and maintain situational awareness, as various threats may arise during the escort. Ensure to communicate effectively with the survivor, providing reassurance and instructions as needed. 

As you move, be aware of your surroundings and ready to respond to any unexpected challenges. Your ability to navigate obstacles and provide cover can make a significant difference in the survivor's safety and successful escape. Stay focused, work as a team, and prioritize the survivor's wellbeing at all times.

Players will be tasked with escorting a survivor to a train. The survivor will spawn in a chamber located somewhere on the map. To begin the escort, players need to reach the chamber. The survivor will be released once a player approaches it. 

Players must remain within a certain range of the survivor for it to start moving toward the railway; if they are not close enough, the survivor will not move. The more players that are within this range, the faster the survivor will move. Additionally, the survivor has the ability to provide healing.

The survivor's presence increases the movement speed of nearby players. Additionally, the survivor can provide healing and armor to themselves and all players within range. The survivor has a health bar, and when their health is depleted, they will be downed, allowing other players to revive them. Once the survivor is close, a train will spawn at the nearby railway, enabling evacuation for the players.

#### Collect Samples:

Don't make up facts or hallucinate. Your job is to enhance the text's coherence and clarity, making it easier to understand.

Several samples will spawn around the map, primarily at the edges, in the form of loot. All players need to collect the indicated samples before time runs out. The number of samples that spawn is determined by the number of players in the lobby. If there are a maximum of four players, five samples will spawn. However, with fewer players in the lobby, the amount of samples to be collected will decrease.

#### Destroy Infected Nests:

Ensure you do not fabricate facts or hallucinate. Your primary task is to enhance the coherence and clarity of the text.

Bombs will spawn, with a maximum of two, at a player's spawn location or near the railway. Players must pick up a bomb and plant it in an infected nest, which is indicated somewhere on the map. The number of infected nests and bombs is determined by the number of players in the lobby. If there are 3 to 4 players, they need to plant 2 bombs. If there are only 1 to 2 players, then they only need to plant 1 bomb.

#### Kills Special Infecteds

Please do not fabricate facts or engage in speculation. Your task is to enhance the coherence and clarity of the text, nothing more.

A group of Special Infected will spawn in various parts of the map, and players must eliminate all of them. The Special Infected include Driller/Digger Infected, Charger Infected, and Brute Lightning Infected. However, they will all receive a buff, making them harder to defeat than regular Special Infected. With a maximum of four players, five Special Infected will spawn, and this number will decrease based on the size of the lobby. On a positive note, each of the Special Infected drops a Golden item.
The number of players in the lobby can influence the game's dynamics. However, this isn't always negative, as each of the Special Infected drops a Golden Crate upon their defeat.

## Types of Infecteds

Currently, there are seven types of infecteds in this mode.

_Note: The names assigned to all infecteds are unofficial and serve only as nicknames for now._

_Note: The names assigned to all infected individuals are unofficial and currently serve only as nicknames._

### Common Infecteds:

#### Basic/Normal Infected

The Basic/Normal Infected are the most common type of infected. They have a medium amount of health, move slowly, and deal around 200+ damage. They first spawn at stage 1.

#### Exploding Infected

Do not make up facts or hallucinate. Your role is to enhance the coherence of the text and make it easier to understand.

They are quite fast and have a body similar to Scout Heroes. They can self-destruct upon contact with a player, dealing decent damage. In the other mode, this is their only ability; however, in PVE mode, they have an additional ability that allows them to fire a projectile. This projectile causes affected players to lose the ability to shoot and slows their movement for a few seconds. They are first spawned at stage 2.
Brute infected have a large health pool and a massive physique. They attack players by stomping the ground, dealing area-of-effect (AOE) damage. They first spawn at stage 3.

#### Lightning Infected

Don't make up facts or hallucinate. Your job is to improve the coherence of the text and make it easier to understand.

Lightning Infected have a similar appearance and statistics as normal infected. However, they are surrounded by a Ball Lightning, similar to Tess's ability, which can disable players' abilities within range. This effect also destroys or disables all placeable abilities, such as Force Fields, Turrets, and Freeze Mines. When Lightning Infected are killed, they will explode, dealing damage and removing nearby abilities.

Abilities such as Force Fields, Turrets, and Freeze Mines enhance gameplay. When these abilities are defeated, they will explode, dealing damage to players within the affected range and disabling their equipped abilities. Additionally, they can provide buffs to nearby infected, allowing them to take reduced damage. These abilities first spawn at stages 4-5.

### Special Infected

#### Digger/Driller Infected

The Digger/Driller Infected are unique variants that pose significant threats in the game. They have the ability to burrow underground, allowing them to ambush unsuspecting players. Their stealth and speed make them formidable adversaries, requiring players to stay vigilant and continuously monitor their surroundings to avoid surprise attacks.

Digger/Driller Infecteds are one of the special infected types in this mode. They possess the ability to perform Molly's burrow attack. When they spot a player, they burrow underground and, upon getting close, launch themselves to the surface, dealing moderate damage and disarming the player's weapon for a few seconds. Fortunately, they can only use this ability once. Digger/Driller Infecteds first spawn at stage 4. Upon being defeated, they can drop golden crates containing powerful upgrades.

#### Charger Infected

The Charger Infected is a special type of zombie characterized by its strength and aggressive behavior. It has the ability to charge at players, dealing significant damage upon impact. Players must be cautious when engaging this enemy, as its charging attack can quickly incapacitate them. To effectively combat the Charger, it's essential to maintain distance and employ strategic tactics.

Chargers are a type of special infected. They are large and durable. Chargers have the ability to charge forward, similar to Ramsay's rampage ability. When they spot a player, they charge at them, knocking down all players in the affected range and stunning them for a few seconds. Fortunately, they can only perform this charge once. Chargers first spawn at stage 5 and can also drop golden crates.

#### Brute Lightning Infected

The Brute Lightning Infected are remarkably similar to the standard Lightning Infected. They are surrounded by a ball of lightning, but they possess significantly higher health and damage. Their method of attack involves stomping the ground, much like the Brute Infected. Additionally, they have the ability to drop golden crates.
