## Tips, Tricks, and Strategy

### Choose the Best Hero(s)

When selecting your hero, consider their unique abilities and how they complement your team. Focus on heroes that enhance your gameplay strategy and work well together.

To increase your chances of winning, it is important to choose the best heroes for this mode. Pay attention to your selected hero's Team/Second Passive, as teamwork is essential. If you're playing in a squad, select a hero who can help address your teammates' weaknesses. Here is a list of recommended heroes chosen by the community.

**Attention**: You can choose to play as any hero you like. The heroes listed below are merely suggestions. 

#### Recommended Heroes to Play:

- Levi - Stuns enemies and delivers decent damage.
- Satoshi - Inflicts great damage and provides armor.
- Tess - Offers excellent crowd control and decent damage.
- Stalker - Highly versatile; provides healing and significantly reduces reload speed almost instantly.

- Angel - Reduces reload speed and provides a damage buff.
- Freddie - Offers great speed, damage, and versatility.
- Twinkle - Known for excellent speed, damage, and versatility.
- Leviathan - Excels in crowd control.

- Leviathan - Great at crowd control  
- Shenji - Offers decent crowd control and damage  
- Cyclops - Blinds enemies and provides decent damage

### Strategies

_Note: Feel free to add your own strategies by editing the page._

### Tips

Do not fabricate information or create false narratives. Your task is solely to enhance the text's coherence and clarity for better understanding.
If you want to pick up a crate without being disrupted by zombies triggering your auto-shoot feature, simply look away while doing so.

After a stage clear, there will be a 10-second timer for your team to collect the loot dropped by the zombies. After 10 seconds, all the loot that remains will be burned and destroyed. However, there is a bug that has not yet been fixed: if you open a crate while it is burning, the loot dropped by that crate will not be destroyed. This can be used as an advantage in certain situations.

Mysterious Temple was introduced during the horror season, along with the new hero Ramsay. This Halloween-themed map features a central church, surrounded by buildings that resemble a library, bedrooms, a mansion, and a graveyard located at the corners.

**Marked Locations:**

- **Blue Area:** This area is filled with consumables.
- **Green Waypoint:** This indicates the spawn location.
- **Yellow Waypoint:** There is a chance for a level 3 crate to spawn at this location.

# Hero Name: Bastion

**Description:** Bastion is equipped with the most powerful armor and a rapid-fire minigun. His ability to deploy a personal power shield makes his armor virtually impenetrable.

**Unlocking Information:** Indicate how this hero can be unlocked.

This hero can be unlocked by opening chests.

## Base Stats

Note: There is a considerable amount of data available, most of which is currently unknown but is utilized in the game. This information is included here to be filled in later.

**Note:** For health, armor, and damage, we need to include base stats and growth per level if they are linear.

**Note:** Character size is relevant (Moki). It can fall into one of three categories: small, medium, or large.

## Skills

Your task is to improve the coherence of this text while ensuring that no false information is introduced. Please focus on making the content easier to understand.

Note: Please fill in the descriptions for level 15 abilities while we work on a more compact format to display all ability levels.

Here, we present only the maximum level skills that can be unlocked at the supreme tier.

### Shield

Don't make up facts or hallucinate. Your task is to enhance the coherence and clarity of the text.

On ability activation, the hero creates a mobile shield with a durability of 20. This shield is designed to absorb damage from most weapons for a duration of 7 seconds.

- **Reloading time:** 8 seconds
- **Replenishment time:** 20 seconds
- **Maximum charges:** 4
- **Starting charges:** 1

### Battle Kit

**Ability Activation**: When activated, the hero experiences a 90% speed reduction and is unable to shoot for 5 seconds. After this duration, the hero restores 950 health and armor and gains an additional 400 maximum health and armor for 10 seconds.

- **Reload Time**: 10 seconds
- **Replenishment Time**: 30 seconds
- **Maximum Charges**: 2
- **Starting Charges**: 1

### Armored

**Passive Bonuses:**

- Increases the hero's maximum armor by 20%.
- Increases the hero's maximum health by 20%.
- Increases the damage of the hero's primary weapon by 20%.
- Provides the hero with 23 armor per second.

**When the hero takes damage:**

- The hero receives an additional 25 armor.

### Defender

**When the hero takes damage:**

**On Hero Taking Damage**:

- Provides +55 armor per second to allies within a 400 range for 1 second.
- Reduces incoming damage by 20% for allies within a 400 range for 1 second.

## Gears and Upgrades

Bastion has access to the Heavy Borg gear set, which is exclusive to tank Heroes.

Bastion has access to the Heavy Borg gear set, which is exclusive to tank Heroes.

The available upgrades for Bastion include:

- Reinforced armor
- Explosive rounds
- Enhanced magazine
- Foregrip

The Silver Surfer is a superhero character in the Marvel Comics universe. Originally known as Norrin Radd, he hails from the planet Zenn-La. The character gained his powers after making a pact with Galactus, a cosmic entity that consumes planets. As the Silver Surfer, he traverses the universe on his surfboard-like craft, fighting for justice and protecting the innocent while grappling with his own existential dilemmas. Over the years, the Silver Surfer has appeared in various comic book series, animated shows, and films, becoming an iconic figure within the Marvel franchise.

Seasons are limited events featured in Bullet Echo. Each new season introduces various additions to the game, including new game modes, new heroes, new hero skins, and other limited events. Each season lasts for 90 to 93 days (approximately 3 months) and is divided into 3 episodes, each lasting 30 to 32 days.

### Performance Cookies

Performance cookies enable us to count visits and sources of traffic, allowing us to measure and enhance our site's performance. While they do not store personal information directly, they work by uniquely identifying your browser and internet device. # Arcade

* Register

* Sign In

Advertisement

* Skip to content

* Sign in to edit

Don't fabricate facts or hallucinate. Your task is to enhance the coherence of the text and make it easier to understand.
Arcade is a game mode in Bullet Echo that is active for a limited time, specifically for three days.

Arcade is a game mode in Bullet Echo that is available for a limited time, specifically for three days. 

Entry requires one ticket, which can be either regular or VIP.

Entry costs 1 ticket, either a regular or VIP ticket.

VIP tickets do not expire and there is no limit on the number of VIP tickets you can hold.

Regular tickets expire when the current arcade event ends, and you can have a maximum of 10 regular tickets.

Regular tickets can be earned by winning battles.

Regular Tickets can be earned by winning battles. However, VIP Tickets cannot be earned; they must be purchased with bucks.

At the end of the Arcade road, there is a skin reward that is typically rare, although it could also be an epic skin.

The rules change with each new Arcade season.

# Gears

- History
- Purge
- Talk (0)

Don't make up facts or hallucinate. Your job is to make the text more coherent and easier to understand.

Gears were introduced in the 3.3 update on September 16, 2020, providing new ways to customize heroes to address any perceived flaws or enhance their attributes, such as reload speed and health. At launch, there were only four gear slots; however, as of December 21, 2020, there are now six gear slots available.

_"Gears! Experiment with your hero: make it swift, sharp, or heavy - the choice is all yours! Collect different gear, augmentations, and implants to shape the perfect fighter!"_

As of the creation of this page, there are six types of gear slots available.

This is the gears menu as of version 3.6.

### Gears Slot

As of version 3.6, the game features two types of gear slots: 6 Private gear slots and 3 Squad gear slots.

**Private Gear Slots:**

- Head
- Body
- Hands/Arms
- Legs
- Rings
- Devices

**Squad Gear Slots:**

- H Injector
- A Generator
- D Exploder

### Gear Categories

- Head
- Body
- Hands/Arms
- Legs
- Rings
- Devices

### Squad Gear Slots

- H Injector
- A Generator
- D Exploder

### Where to Find Gears

The only way to obtain gears is by completing Missions, where they are awarded at random. Additionally, there is an option to purchase a gear box with currency.

### **How to Upgrade Gears**

To upgrade gears, you need to use Bolts, which can be found in chests within the mission tab. Currently, you usually receive only 2 Bolts from each chest, no more and no less. Additionally, you will need duplicates of the gear you want to upgrade. 

For example, upgrading a common gear to a rare gear requires 100 Bolts and 4 copies of that particular gear.

To upgrade a common gear to a rare gear, you will need 100 Bolts and 4 copies of the gear.

##### Leg Gears

Leg gears are essential equipment designed to enhance the performance and protection of the lower limbs during various activities. They come in different styles and materials, each suited for specific purposes. Proper selection of leg gears can significantly impact comfort, mobility, and safety in your endeavors.
| ![Regular Boots](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/bullet-echo/images/8/89/Regular_Boots.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20201028011329) | ![Runner's

Regular Boots decrease the spread of a hero's primary weapon while moving. Runner's Boots increase the hero's movement speed. Tactical Knee Pads reduce the spread of the hero's primary weapon when aimed. Tech Knee Pads enhance the hero's primary weapon performance.
Aimed fire spread: Tech Knee Pads increase the hero's primary weapon fire rate, while the Precision Implant enhances the hero's movement while aiming.

##### Ring Gears

Ring gears are essential components in various machinery and applications. These gears typically feature a circular shape with teeth around the perimeter, allowing them to mesh with other gears in a system. They play a crucial role in transferring motion and force within mechanical assemblies, including vehicles and industrial equipment. Understanding the function and design of ring gears is key to optimizing performance and reliability in gear systems.

The Lock Amulet is a significant item in the game. It has various uses that contribute to gameplay strategies and character abilities. Understanding its functions can enhance your performance and overall experience in the game.

- Thug Knuckle: Increases hero damage against enemy health.  
- Energy Coil: Provides the hero with armor per second.  
- Personal ID Ring: Grants the hero health per second.  
- Wedding Ring: Enhances hero damage against armor.  
- Lock Amulet: Decreases hero ammo pickup time.

#### Weaponry Gears

Weaponry gears, also known as set gears, are exclusive to specific classes. Each of the five classes has its own unique weaponry gears. These gears are typically more expensive to upgrade and harder to obtain. Additionally, they provide bonus effects based on the number of gears equipped on your hero—2, 4, or 6.

#### Personal Gears:

Personal gears are exclusive items available only for specific heroes. They provide greater value and effects compared to other types of gears. These gears are challenging to obtain, as they can only be acquired through events and are costly to upgrade. Similar to weaponry gears, personal gears also grant bonus effects based on the number equipped.

### Squad Gears

Squad gears are exclusive to specific heroes, even though they appear identical and provide the same effects. The effects of these gears will also influence nearby teammates. The gear consists of three items, as shown in the table below.

|     |     |     |
| --- | --- | --- |
| ![](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/bullet-echo/images/5/52/Squad_gear.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240502133948) It features Slayer's picture, indicating that it belongs to Slayer's squad gear set. All heroes have one. |
| D Exploder: Increase damage | A Generator: Increase armor capacity | H Injector: Increase health capacity |

Squad gear provides a bonus buff for your squad, starting at 1% and increasing by 1% with each upgrade. When you equip all three pieces of gear, it grants a bonus buff to the second passive ability of your heroes.

## In-game Description

Vi is equipped with a pellet-firing assault rifle, making her most effective at close range. Her ability to dash in any direction allows her to easily close the distance to enemies or escape from them.

## Abilities

Here, all abilities at the maximum level (Stellar) are shown.

### Main Ability: 

#### Shadow Step 

Please ensure not to fabricate facts or hallucinate. Your task is solely to enhance the coherence and clarity of the text.

- **Max Charges:** 3  
- **Replenishment Time:** 12 Seconds  
- **Starting Charges:** 1  

**ON ABILITY ACTIVATION**  

When activated, the hero dashes a distance of **350** in the direction of her movement. During this dash, the hero becomes invulnerable to nearly all types of damage and can pass through narrow passages, force walls, and enemies.  

If the dash collides with an enemy, it deals **520** damage and increases the hero's movement speed by **30%** for **2 seconds**.

If the dash hits an enemy, it inflicts **520** damage and increases the hero's movement speed by **30%** for **2 seconds**.

### Medical

#### Team Healing

**On Ability Activation:**

When activated, the hero is slowed down by **50%** for **7 seconds.**

- **Reloading Time:** 20 seconds
- **Replenishment Time:** 30 seconds
- **Maximum Charges:** 2
- **Starting Charges:** 0

Width of consumables in terms of range

A hero's fire range refers to the radius of their aim cone, extending from the top of their shadow to the end of that cone. 

It is important not to confuse this with projectile range, which measures the distance a projectile can travel.

This should not be confused with projectile range, which refers to the distance a projectile can travel.

Consumables, such as ammo, armor, upgrades, etc., typically have a range of approximately 42 units.

Gear, scopes, and abilities can modify a hero's range.

# Team Deathmatch

- History
- Purge
- Talk (0)

Team Deathmatch is a competitive game mode where two teams battle against each other to achieve the highest number of eliminations. Each team aims to outmaneuver and outgun their opponents while strategizing to secure victory. Players must work together effectively, utilizing their skills and teamwork to dominate the battlefield.

## TDM

TDM, or Team Deathmatch, is a new gamemode introduced in Bullet Echo with the Twinkle Update in December 2024.

Performance cookies help us understand how visitors interact with our website, allowing us to improve its performance.

#### Performance Cookies

Performance Cookies

These cookies enable us to count visits and traffic sources, allowing us to measure and enhance the performance of our site. They help us identify which pages are the most and least popular, as well as track how visitors navigate the site. All information collected by these cookies is aggregated and anonymous. If you choose not to allow these cookies, we will be unable to determine when you visited our site and will not be able to assess its performance.

#### Targeting Cookies

#### Targeting Cookies

Targeting cookies may be set on our site by our advertising partners. These cookies help those companies create a profile of your interests, allowing them to show you relevant ads on other websites. While they do not store personal information directly, they uniquely identify your browser and internet device. If you choose not to allow these cookies, you may see less targeted advertising.

#### Social Media Cookies

Social media cookies are used to enable sharing of content across social media platforms and to track engagement with that content. These cookies can also help improve your online experience by personalizing the content you see and allowing you to remain logged in to various services.

### Social Media Cookies

Social media cookies are set by various social media platforms integrated into our site. These cookies allow you to share our content with your friends and networks. Additionally, they can track your browsing across other sites and create a profile of your interests. This tracking may influence the content and advertisements you encounter on other websites. If you do not allow these cookies, you may be unable to access or utilize the sharing tools.
